Title: Business Data Analyst
Desc: About Armour Group Inc. Armour Group Inc., established in 1996 and headquartered in London, Ontario, markets and administers multiple lines of products in the automobile, recreational, heating and cooling and lending marketplaces. We focus on building relationships not only with our clients but also with the customers our clients serve.The Armour Group Inc. is looking for a full-time Business Data Analyst to join their team in the London, ON office. Remuneration commensurate with experience.Position OverviewWith the Armour Group’s commitment to create and manage innovative products and processes, the Business Data Analyst will be responsible for managing and developing all our data analyses, data collecting systems and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality. The successful candidate will be highly skilled in all aspects of data analytics to turn data into information, information into insight and insight into business decisions.Here’s what you will deliver· Interpret data, analyze results and provide ongoing reports on product and program performances· Identify trends and opportunities for growth through analysis of complex data sets· Work closely with the senior management to understand and maintain focus on analytical needs, including identifying critical metrics and KPIs· Proactively analyze data to answer key questions from stakeholders or out of self-initiated curiosity with an eye for what drives business performance, investigating and communicating areas for improvement in efficiency and productivity· Create and maintain rich interactive visualizations through data interpretation and analysis, integrating various reporting components from multiple data sources· Develop and maintain databases by acquiring data from primary and secondary sources, and build scripts that will make our data evaluation process more flexible and scalable across data sets· Analyze local, national, and global trends that impact both the organization and the industry· Remove corrupted data and identify errors and related problems· Work with management on adhoc projects to prioritize business and information needsHere’s what you bring to the table· 2 - 3 years’ experience in mining data as a data analyst· Bachelor’s degree in Business, Mathematics, Computer Science, Economics, or Statistics an asset· Proven analytic skills, including mining, evaluation, analysis, and visualization· Proficient in Microsoft Office products, databases and working knowledge in SQL· Experience working in data visualization software like Power BI or Tableau· Highly organized, detail oriented, and able to thrive in a fast paced, changing environment· Demonstrate effective verbal, listening, and written communication skills· Attention to detail and ability to maintain a high level of accuracy· Excellent time management skills, ability to multitask and work well under pressureWhat’s in it for you· Excellent management support and guidance· Access to health, dental and vision insurance· Employee Assistance Plan (EAP) for you and your family’s wellnessJob Types: Full-time, PermanentSalary: From $55,000.00 per yearBenefits:Dental careExtended health careVision careSchedule:8 hour shiftCOVID-19 considerations:Our office does not have customer traffic. Provincial health measures are followed as required.Application deadline: 2022-04-22

Title: Data Protection Analyst - 336602
Desc:
Data Protection Analyst
On behalf of our client in the Banking Sector, PROCOM is looking for a Data Protection Analyst.
Data Protection Analyst – Job Description

As a Data Protection Analyst in the Capital Markets Application Access Control Group (AACG), you will enhance, implement, monitor and support data loss protection controls and processes within Capital Markets
Implement data protection rules to monitor, alert and block suspicious activity
Analyze reporting to identify and follow up on suspicious activities and opportunities for exemptions
Onboard users to bank’s preferred data protection solutions
Manage the clean-up of legacy access exemptions, including monitoring and reporting monthly metrics to track project progress
Identify process improvement/reengineering opportunities through streamlining, simplification, elimination of redundancies, automation, standardization, etc.
Create and maintain reporting related to the monitoring of key data loss and cyber risk initiatives
Assist with implementing improvements to reporting dashboards that monitor and highlight data loss/cyber risk areas
Work with businesses across Capital Markets and collaborate with business partners across the Enterprise to support data loss and cyber risk initiatives
Work with functional groups across the organization (i.e., internet security, data protection team, compliance, operational risk, supplier management office, etc.) to create, document, and maintain operational processes; provide guidance, assistance and support
Act as the primary support contact for Capital Markets related cyber risk and data loss inquiries
Constantly seek to improve own capacity, skills and expertise and communicate regularly with management and other relevant parties to keep impacted resources informed

Data Protection Analyst – Mandatory Skills

A good understanding of data risk and exposures
Hybrid BA/Data Analyst role
Strong Data skills
Ability to multi-task, prioritize and work independently under tight deadlines in a fast-paced environment
Ability to remain persistent and pursue evidence during investigations to reach a resolution
Strong interpersonal, verbal and written communication skills, with an ability to work effectively with all levels of staff and management
Strong analytical, trend analysis, problem identification and resolution skills
Fully proficient with MS Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook)

Data Protection Analyst – Nice to Have Skills

Experience in creating and implementing reporting and processes
Experience with identifying and implementing process/system changes which reduce risk, increase efficiencies or enrich customer service
Experience working in data loss/cyber risk/cyber security

Data Protection Analyst - Assignment Start Date
ASAP – 12 months to start
Data Protection Analyst - Assignment Location
Toronto, ON – Work Hybrid

Title: Data Analyst
Desc:
Overview:

KPMG is an industry leading firm that serves clients on a variety of specialized projects that help them to work smarter, grow faster and compete better.
Why join our contract workforce?
Interesting work: Deliver work that matters to you. We provide the opportunity to get involved in highly technical, complex and interesting projects where you can leverage your specific skillset and expertise to add value.
Enrich your skills: Access to best-in-class technology, market intelligence and resources to advance your unique technical skills and expertise. Work alongside diverse, passionate and highly skilled professionals working together to drive innovation.
Flexible opportunities: Find projects that match when and where you want to work.
The opportunity
Our Toronto operations team needs a talented and forward-thinking Data Analyst at the Manager/Consultant level to design, create, deploy, maintain, and evolve our visualization platforms. In addition to building actionable insights through various BI platforms, you will be responsible for managing and evolving our time-series revenue forecasting platform. Our growing scope on Data Analytics and Digital Innovation requires an experienced data analyst to accelerate the development of our various visual analytics in support of our business stakeholders across our national Advisory practice. The role will be primarily focused on leveraging CRM and financial data in order to make informed decisions and provide insights to senior leaders.
What you will do:
Work directly with our finance and operations leaders on business use cases and presenting solutions to our key stakeholders.
Map business requirements to technical solutions.
Turn complex data into easy-to-understand visual insights that are aligned to business objectives.
Develop a user experience that is simple, yet flexible to our business needs.
Incorporate data governance and access controls.
Visual storytelling through Tableau and Power BI dashboards.
Build effective data pipelines to make data highly usable (and accessible) to stakeholders using SQL and Alteryx
Maintain and evolve our revenue forecast platform across our national advisory practice and its respective service lines.
Participate in Data Science activities including managing revenue forecasting, inhouse solutions, and providing statistical overview/concepts
Your qualifications:
5+ years of Data Analyst experience developing and designing dashboards and reports in Tableau and Power BI with strong understanding of the design process and best practices around dashboard development and visual perception.
Proficient at SQL, including SQL ETL processes, data manipulation, and data pipeline development.
Experience creating complex calculations (including LOD expressions), action filters, user filters and advanced dashboard best practices in Tableau
Alteryx experience is a plus
Experience working with financial data and an understanding of key financial drivers that impact a professional service firm and basic to intermediate experience in time-series forecasting and statistical knowledge are a plus
Understanding of data science and data modeling based on user specs
Our Values, The KPMG Way:

Integrity, we do what is right | Excellence, we never stop learning and improving | Courage, we think and act boldly | Together, we respect each other and draw strength from our differences | For Better, we do what matters
KPMG is committed to the health and safety of our people, clients and communities. With this commitment in mind, KPMG complies with all public health mandates (provincially and/or federally, as applicable) and has implemented various safety measures, including a COVID-19 Vaccination Policy. KPMG's COVID 19 Vaccination Policy requires all employees to be fully vaccinated if they wish to or are required to attend a KPMG office and/or other congregate settings in the course of their duties (such as client sites or third-party venues).
As this role requires occasional or consistent attendance at a KPMG office and/or congregate setting, the successful candidate must be fully vaccinated (i.e. have received all doses that are recommended by Health Canada, including any boosters) and must provide KPMG with proof of vaccination. KPMG will provide reasonable accommodation if the successful candidate cannot be vaccinated due to grounds protected by human rights legislation in their province of employment.
KPMG in Canada is a proud equal opportunities employer and we are committed to creating a respectful, inclusive and barrier-free workplace that allows all of our people to reach their full potential. A diverse workforce is key to our success and we believe in bringing your whole self to work. We welcome all qualified candidates to apply and hope you will choose KPMG in Canada as your employer of choice.
For general recruitment-related inquiries, please contact the HR Delivery Centre at cafmcdnhrsthotline@kpmg.ca.
If you have a question about accessible employment at KPMG, or to begin a confidential conversation about your individual accessibility or accommodation needs through the recruitment process, we encourage you to contact us at cafmcdnhrsthotline@kpmg.ca or phone: 416-777-8002 or toll free 1-888-466-4778.

Title: Data Analyst

sound SQL and database knowledge and experience working on queries and reportsKnowledge and/or experience in the health care sector such as OHFS (Ontario Healthcare Financial and Statistical System) reporting an assetPrivacy training (PHIPA) an assetDemonstrated effective verbal and written communications skillsAbility to work independently with high levels of initiativeStrong interpersonal and time management skillsProject management knowledge an assetSatisfactory Police Vulnerable Sector CheckSensitivity to adults with needs related to aging, physical and/or mental healthAdhere to COVID-19 safety practices including two doses of COVID-19 VaccineMust work in a safe manner and promote the health and safety of all staff, volunteers, clients and the community as outlined within CCD policiesCompensation: Starting at $51,302 annually, three (3) weeks’ vacation per year of work (pro-rated to hours worked); Title: ICQA Data Analyst
Desc:
2+ years of experience in a business analyst/data analyst/statistical analyst role and conducting analysis and data mining using Excel.
1+ years experience extracting and processing data using SQL.
1+ years project management experience

Job summary
At Amazon, we're working to be the most customer-centric company on earth. To get there, we need exceptionally talented, bright, and driven people. If you'd like to help us build the place to find and buy anything online, this is your chance to make history. This role requires an individual with excellent analytical abilities, outstanding business acumen and exceptional written and oral communication skills. The successful candidate will have a strong understanding of different business models and the underlying analytics, and the ability to assimilate new methodologies and data sources. They will be a self-starter comfortable with ambiguity, with strong attention to detail, be vocally self-critical, and with an ability to work in a fast-paced and ever-changing environment. They recognize that the true measure of the work product is the business impact it has.
Responsibilities:
 Partner with the program team to create key performance indicators and new methodologies for measurement. Understand drivers, impacts on key influences on business dynamics and productivity. Translate data into actionable insights for the stakeholders. Automate reporting for weekly business metrics; identify areas of opportunity to automate and scale ad-hoc analyses.

Bachelor's degree in Business, Engineering, Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Supply Chain or related field.
3+ years of relevant experience in a business analyst/data analyst/statistical analysis role.
Understanding of data warehousing and data modeling.
Experience conducting advanced statistical analysis (skilled in using one or more of R/SPSS/SAS/Python and etc.).
Excellent communication (verbal, written, and data presentation) and interpersonal skills to effectively communicate with both business and technical teams.
Ability to deal with ambiguity and competing objectives in a fast paced environment.
Software development experience / Coding knowledge

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Desc:
Overview:

It’s an exciting time to be at OSL Retail Services, working for a people focused company that’s at the top of its game. The momentum we’ve generated in recent years with our commitments to client customers, innovation, business results, and an entrepreneurial spirit has created energy, enthusiasm, and engagement among our employees that is pushing us to new heights. And we’re on the lookout for talented people who share our vision and values and want to join us in this journey. At OSL, our culture is our foundation. Passionate employees, great customer service and long-term relationships are all built upon that foundation. We value people, passion, honesty, respect, and integrity.
Summary:
Reporting to the Data Systems Manager, the Junior Data Analyst responsibilities include conducting full lifecycle analysis to include requirements, activities, and design. The Data Analyst will develop analysis and reporting capabilities. They will also monitor performance and quality control plans to identify improvements.
Responsibilities:
Interpret data, analyze results using statistical techniques and provide regular, timely, accurate reports
Maintain and monitor production system alerts and provided triage support for priority systems.
Communicated state of service availability and continuity to business units
Develop and implement databases, data collection systems, data analytics and other strategies that optimize statistical efficiency and quality
Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases/data systems
Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex data sets
Filter and clean data by reviewing reports and performance indicators to locate and correct code problems
Work with management to prioritize business and information needs
Locate and define new process improvement opportunities
Who we’re looking for:
Proven working experience as a data analyst or business data analyst
Technical expertise regarding data models, database design development, data mining and segmentation techniques
Strong knowledge of and experience with reporting packages, databases, SQL, programming, XML, Javascript, or ETL frameworks
Knowledge of statistics and experience using statistical packages for analyzing datasets, Excel, SPSS, SAS
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze, and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
Excellent organizational skills
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Knowledge of application flows and application development processes
Confidence and ability to work in a highly visible, fast-paced environment with minimal supervision, capable of delivering quality results with high expectations of workload output.
Adept at queries, report writing, data visualization and presenting findings (Experience with Domo preferred)
BS in Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management or Statistics an asset
What’s in it for you:
Competitive base salary plus bonuses and other perks
Vacation plus additional flex days
Comprehensive benefits
Training and development opportunities to grow your career with one of Canada’s Best Managed Companies
A supportive workplace culture and work environment
If this sounds like you and you’re excited to be a member of our team, please apply now.
We thank all interested applicants; however, only qualified candidates will be contacted. This position requires the successful completion of a criminal background check.
Disclaimer: The preceding job description has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed by employees within this job. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job.
OSL is committed to an inclusive workplace that does not discriminate against race, nationality, religion, age, marital status, physical or mental disability, sexual orientation, gender, or gender identity. We believe in diversity and encourage any qualified individual to apply. We are an EEOC Employer.

Title: iGAMING ANALYST
Desc:
Niagara Casinos is committed to developing a new online market for internet gaming that combines iGaming with the bricks and mortar properties. The iGaming Analyst will play a key role in compiling and analyzing data, implementing strategic processes and procedures, executing business analytics and project management support for the launch of a new line of business for Niagara Casinos. If you would like to be on a team of Great People delivering great service, we may have just the opportunity for you!
The job involves: 

Assisting with strategic planning and initiatives to drive ROI through qualitative and quantitative analysis
Designing, drafting and producing reports and analysis based on specific business requirements for stakeholders using data from the platform’s analytic environments, web analytics tools, research and financial databases for iGaming
Working with the iGaming team to provide analytical support for product development and operation, including player journey and engagement, retention and marketing
Performing financial reporting, planning, and analysis including budgets, forecasts and predictive modeling. Proposing and developing initiatives that positively impact monetization metrics specifically around game economy and progression
Collaborating with vendors and partners to test and verify that solutions meet business requirements, monitoring the progress of multiple concurrent projects and making agile adjustments to ensure successful completion
Flexibility to support a 24/7 operation

The ideal candidate has: 

University degree or college diploma in Business, Computer Science, Mathematics and Statistics, Finance, Economics or equivalent advanced degree
3 years experience in reporting and analytics
Demonstrated leadership, organizational and coordination skills, excellent communication skills
Extensive knowledge of contemporary software and computer systems including Microsoft Access, SQL and other relational database systems
Experience with data visualization and reporting design tools such as Tableau

Niagara Casinos is committed to creating an accessible and inclusive environment by providing equal opportunity to candidates of all abilities. Accommodations are available upon request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process.

Day shift
Monday to Friday

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Desc:
Join our Winning Team as a Senior Data Analyst

When was the last time you bragged about where you work? At CARFAX, we do it every day. Why? Because we’re proud to work for a company with a strong mission and trusted brand. We’re proud to work with people who care about what they do and work hard every day to deliver their best. And just announced, the return of the 4-day work week from May 30th through Labour Day! We’ve created the type of company culture where the term, “work- hard play- hard” isn’t just a catchy saying, it’s part of the #CARFAXdifference!
As a Senior Data Analyst, you will be working with the Data Services and Data Technologies teams to provide key analytical support to a machine learning initiative. You will work collaboratively with a team of engineers and data scientists to help design, build and scale our ambitious machine learning and natural language processing solutions.
As a Senior Data Analyst, your responsibilities will include:
Gathering training data for the existing deep learning, ML and NLP solutions
Providing actionable ad hoc analytics insights for internal stakeholders
Designing and building recurring reports for internal stakeholders to make data-driven decisions
Identifying and implementing ways to supercharge data quality and data integrity
Using advanced analytical methods to explore and extract additional data value for existing and emerging products
Documenting analysis results and presenting value to stakeholders
Creating reusable processes to assist data evaluation and analysis across teams within Data Center
To be considered for this role, you will need:
3-5 years of direct experience performing advanced data analytics or a Master’s Degree in Statistics, Data Analytics or related field
3+ years’ experience in SQL/Spark, R, Python
Strong grasp of statistical modeling techniques such as linear regression, logistic regression, GLM, etc.
Understand NLP concepts like: Named Entity Recognition (NER), Sentiment Analysis, Data Tokenization, Lexical Semantics, Relationship Extraction, etc.
Ability to effectively communicate analysis and insights to all levels of the organization
A passion for continuous learning
Confidence to challenge the status quo
Automotive industry experience a plus

Title: LMS Analyst
Desc:
Build Your Career at Aecon
Aecon is proud to build some of the most impactful infrastructure projects of this generation. From the roads and transit systems that connect our communities, to the communication networks that link us from coast-to-coast, and the water infrastructure that supplies our businesses and homes. Our integral work includes constructing the pipelines that join provinces with the energy that fuels the nation, and the airports and ports that connect us all. Aecon is there, safely and sustainably building the future.

We lead the infrastructure industry with purpose, and our people are at the heart of everything we do. Our business success relies on strong execution and continuous improvement – driven by the diversity, expertise and teamwork of our employees. We are always searching the globe for exceptional candidates to join the Aecon family and be a part of our forward-thinking, innovative, best-in-class organization!


Our HR Team is seeking a LMS Analyst to join our team to partner with learning program owners, and set up LMS activities using a consultative approach. This is a dynamic and analytical role, requiring the successful candidate to enjoy all things collaboration and innovation, with a research focused mindset.

What You'll Do Here
Partner with learning program owners to setup LMS activities using a consultative approach.
Support platform governance and quality assurance initiatives by documenting standard operating procedures and monitoring process compliance.
Research, identify, and recommend improvements to LMS configuration.
Collaborate with internal learning teams and IT partners to provide LMS troubleshooting.
Upload, maintain, schedule, and create courses, curricula, and assignment profiles in the LMS.
Researching technical issues to resolve user questions and issues.
Monitor and manage the ticketing system and training mailbox daily and provide timely response to inquiries related to training and systems.
Run system reports and develops custom reports to meet data analytic needs.
Collaborate with various stakeholders to roll out global specific learning and training initiatives.
Leveraging strong knowledge of LMS capabilities ensuring ongoing process improvement within the LMS, proposing systems enhancements aligned with business objectives and needs.
Work with key stakeholders to collaborate on new training to ensure LMS system optimizes the learning content and user experience.
Remain current on new LMS releases, coordinates user acceptance testing, and communicate changes as needed to appropriate groups.
Participate in and provides consultation and expertise to internal project teams.
Supports and leads other programs and special projects as necessary.

What You Bring to the Team
3-5 years’ experience in SucessFactors LMS module.
Additional experience using the Successfactors platform preferred.
Advanced research and data analysis skills and a demonstrated ability to draw associated insights and make effective recommendations.
Progressive and forward thinking, research industry trends and innovations.
Provide consultation and develop training materials.
Ability to successfully navigate a fast-paced, complex and changing work environment, while managing multiple and shifting priorities.
Demonstrated ability and confidence in presenting and delivering content to end users, which in some cases can be fairly complex information.
Highly developed problem-solving ability and critical thinking skills.
Strong ability to collaborate with others in order to achieve the best results and deliver the most value.
Excellent organizational and interpersonal skills.
Excellent communication skills.

Title: Brand Insight Analyst
Data Analyst
Desc:
The Opportunity

Unity's Create Data & Analytics Team is looking to add an experienced Data Analyst to our team, in supporting our efforts in data-driven decision making, evaluation performance of marketing channels and other revenue enablement activities. This role will work very closely with cross-functional business partners, marketing specialists, product marketers, and external vendors supporting Unity's marketing efforts. You will also build working relationships with business leaders to define core business metrics, building dashboards and tools to monitor the health of Unity's business, acting as a visualization expert with a variety of data tools!

You will be responsible for translating business problems to useful analytics tasks. Ideal candidates would have strong exploratory data analysis and data visualization skills, great attention to detail and confidence in presenting findings to diverse groups of users!

What you'll be doing:

Reconciling data between diverse sets of tools, assuring accuracy and driving data flow improvements
Maintaining data quality and integrity of the data in partnership with Enterprise Data Warehouse Team and Data Engineers
Working directly with internal partners to understand data needs and develop scalable solutions with rapid development and re-usability in mind
Delivering results/managing projects on-time with respect to SLA's and managing expectations via JIRA

What we're looking for:

Through understanding of Marketing ROI/ROAS optimization techniques, multi touch attribution methodology, and finding predictors for conversion rate optimization
Prior experience supporting large Marketing organizations (Paid Search, Account Based Marketing, Paid Social, Performance Media) preferred
Experience in online advertising measurement role using Google Marketing Platform (Google Analytics, Campaign Manager, Bid Manager, Paid Search, Display Network) and other online advertising ecosystems
Developed skills in SQL, Python, R, Relational Cloud Based Databases (Redshift, Snowflake), DataWarehouse and Big Data Platforms (Google Big Query)
Expertise in data visualization tools (Data Studio, Looker, Tableau, RShiny, D3)

You might have:

Strong analytical foundations (requirements gathering, exploratory data analysis, metrics and KPI definition, visualization, and presentation)
A strong belief in data democratization across the business units
A great attitude towards working in a collaborative environment with a large number of technical and non-technical collaborators (marketing, product management, web analytics, DWH)
Prior exposure to DSPs and other biddable media platforms is a huge plus

You may also have

Familiarity with the ad serving industry and internet technologies.
Prior experience with Looker & Data Studio, as well as with Airflow
Work experience with Python, Jupyter Notebooks, Google Collab

Life at Unity

Unity (NYSE: U) is the world's leading platform for creating and operating real-time 3D (RT3D) content. Creators, ranging from game developers to artists, architects, automotive designers, filmmakers, and others, use Unity to make their imaginations come to life. Unity is the foundation upon which the world's most powerful digital content is created. Specifically, Unity's platform provides a comprehensive set of software solutions to create, run and monetize interactive, real-time 2D and 3D content for mobile phones, tablets, PCs, consoles, and augmented and virtual reality devices.

In the fourth quarter of 2021, Unity had, on average, 3.9 billion monthly active end users who consumed content created or operated with its solutions. The applications developed by these creators were downloaded, on average, five billion times per month in 2021. For more information, please visit www.unity.com.

Unity is an equal opportunity employer committed to fostering an inclusive, innovative environment with the best employees. Therefore, we provide employment opportunities without regard to age, race, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, disability, sex, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, or any other protected status in accordance with applicable law. If there are preparations or accommodations we can make to help ensure you have a comfortable and positive interview experience, please let us know.

Headhunters and recruitment agencies may not submit resumes/CVs through this website or directly to managers. Unity does not accept unsolicited headhunter and agency resumes. Unity will not pay fees to any third-party agency or company that does not have a signed agreement with Unity.

À propos de Unity

Unity (NYSE: U) est la plateforme la plus utilisée au monde pour la création et l'exécution interactive de contenu 3D en temps réel (RT3D). Des créateur(rice)s, notamment des développeur(se)s de jeux vidéo, des artistes, des architectes, des concepteur(rice)s automobiles, des cinéastes et bien d'autres professionnel(le)s, utilisent Unity pour donner vie à leurs projets. Unity constitue la base sur lesquelles sont créés les contenus numériques les plus remarquables au monde. Plus précisément, la plateforme de Unity offre un ensemble complet de solutions logicielles pour créer, exécuter et monétiser du contenu interactif 2D et 3D en temps réel pour les téléphones mobiles, les tablettes, les ordinateurs, les consoles et les appareils de réalité augmentée et de réalité virtuelle.

Au quatrième trimestre de l'année 2021, Unity comptait en moyenne 3,9 milliards d'utilisateurs finaux actifs mensuels ayant consommé du contenu créé ou exploité au moyen de ses solutions. Les applications développées par ces créateurs ont été téléchargées en moyenne cinq milliards de fois par mois en 2021. Pour en savoir davantage, veuillez consulter le site www.unity.com.

Unity est un employeur axé sur l'égalité des chances qui s'engage à favoriser un environnement inclusif et innovateur avec les meilleurs employés. Par conséquent, nous fournissons des opportunités d'emploi sans tenir compte de l'âge, l'ethnicité, la couleur, l'ascendance, l'origine nationale, la religion, le handicap, le sexe, l'identité sexuelle ou l'expression, l'orientation sexuelle ou tout autre statut protégé. S'il y a des préparatifs ou des ajustements que nous pouvons faire afin de vous aider à avoir une expérience d'entrevue confortable et positive, veuillez-nous le faire savoir.

Les chasseurs de têtes et les agences de recrutement ne peuvent pas soumettre résumes/CV par ce site Web ou directement aux superviseurs. Unity n'accepte pas des chasseurs de têtes non sollicités et des résumés (CV) d'agence. Unity ne payera pas d'honoraires à aucune agence tierce ou entreprise qui n'a pas signé d'ententes avec Unity.

Title: Market Data Operation and Engineering Analyst
Desc:
Come Work with Us!  At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.  Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.





































































































 Job Title




































 Market Data Operation and Engineering Analyst
  





































 Job Description






































 What is the opportunity? 

To provide solution and support for Market Data and Messaging Middleware platforms for RBC business users and applications globally. Contribute to the global technical strategies and engineering of those platforms. Liaison between developers, technology staff and management to ensure high quality requirements and engineering of Market Data and messaging platforms.

 What will you do? 

Provide services on all areas of Market Data technology –architecture, engineering, implementation and support.
 Partner with application development team to ensure that market data/Messaging dependency risk are minimized and that needs are fully understood and met.
 Participation from stakeholders beyond just the development and operation teams.
 Responsible for the operational support of Market Data Monitoring systems. This includes assessment and communication of outages and incidents to the correct audience
 Partner with ITRS monitoring team to ensure monitoring requirements are fully understood and met.
 Ensure documentation on all systems in use for production and disaster recovery and regulatory purposes.
 Ensure production problems, bugs, system problems/changes are documented and requests are acted upon promptly. Keep Senior Management advised of situations that may compromise agreed deliverables and/or affect production systems
 Provide on-call support for global clients, rotating amongst all global engineers


 What do you need to succeed? 

Must Have 

Hands on knowledge of Symphony, Refinitiv TREP, Bloomberg BPIPE, DACS, Solace, Kafka, and/or other low latency Direct Exchange feed handlers and distribution platforms.
 Programming knowledge and shell scripting
 Programming with Messaging ChatBot
 Understanding of Market Data concepts: Datafeeds, stock exchanges, Market Data and messaging middleware/distribution, IDBs and vendor reporting requirements


 Nice to Have

 Experience of underlying networking and server technologies used in low latency infrastructures (10/40/100GbE, Linux, TCP/UDP Offloading cards, etc.)
 Unix/Linux, Windows, Android, iOS, Database
 Knowledge of Exchange Datafeeds provided by the main North American Equity markets (NYSE, Nasdaq, BATS, DirectEdge, CME etc.) and the technologies used to deliver those feeds in both client and co-located facilities.
 Experience with data visualization tools (e.g. Tableau and/or Grafana).


 What’s in it for you? 

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

 A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable
 Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
 Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
 Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
 A world-class training program in financial services
 Flexible work/life balance options
 Opportunities to do challenging work
 Opportunities to take on progressively greater accountabilities
 Opportunities to building close relationships with clients
 Access to a variety of job opportunities across business and geographies
 The successful candidate will need to establish and maintain productive working relationships with Advisors and individuals at all levels, both internally and externally.


 RBC requires as a condition of employment that all successful candidates in the United States and Canada be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to their start date, and may require proof of the same. Reasonable accommodation is available where required by law.  RBC exige, à titre de condition d’emploi, que tous les candidats retenus aux États-Unis ou au Canada soient entièrement vaccinés contre la COVID-19 avant leur date d’entrée en fonction. Il est possible qu’ils aient à présenter une preuve vaccinale. Des mesures raisonnables d’adaptation sont offertes lorsque la loi l’exige

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Desc:
Requisition ID: 131117

Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.
The Team
The Global Fraud Technology team develops and manages innovative products designed to continuously strengthen the bank’s posture against the ever-changing Fraud threat landscape. We are part of the Global Engineering and Operations Functions team and we work in close partnership with our Fraud Business and key Technology Partners throughout Scotiabank to drive implementation of global products that will protect and strengthen the bank. We work with advanced technologies and are looking for key team members that have a passion to learn and deliver.
The Role
Global Fraud Technology Team is looking for an energetic and results-oriented Data Analyst to join our team to help in continuing to build and enhance our Business Intelligence capabilities.
We’re looking to fill our team with influencers, makers, creators and leaders who are flexible, curious, adventurous, versatile and responsive; and who are ready to roll up their sleeves in a collaborative and productive environment to get things done.
Some of the Key Accountabilities include:
Conduct discovery sessions with business teams to understand and capture their processes, formulate alternative to improve productivity using analytics and automation, and define the related key performance indicators
Take on assigned data mining, analysis, profiling, and modeling activities and complete them within competing priorities and deadlines
Devise design alternatives for ingesting data for analytics, management reports and dashboards
Complete data and access governance assessments for internal and external regulatory and legislative compliance
Prepare test plans and test cases and conduct and coordinate quality assurance testing with end-users and obtain business acceptance sign off
Prepare defined documentation where required within the framework of the project and solution delivery – including and not limited to requirements, process and data flow diagram, and data mapping
Contribute to the story mapping, creating user stories, and furnishing user stories with details were needed
Work closely with business stakeholders, product owner, and developers and addressing their ad-hoc data, information, and analysis requests
What You Will Bring to Succeed
You are curious and highly motivated to discover new relations in business data, understand and interpret data, tell the story of how it is used in business processes, and how to deliver business value by transforming it
You have 5-7 years extensive knowledge of business intelligence tools and programming languages
You have 5-7 years experience in working for large projects and have advanced experience with SQL, ETL, data analysis and profiling, data mapping, data modeling, data lakes, and analytics
You are excellent in written and spoken English to clearly communicate complex issues and interface with all levels of the organization with ease
You have excellent interpersonal, prioritization, and issues management skills for building strong collaborative relationships with stakeholders and coworkers
You are highly organized, disciplined, and responsive in a fast paced and demanding environment
You constantly and strongly demonstrate the core values that continuously advance the productivity of high-performing and self-organizing teams: respect, commitment, courage, openness, and focus
The Workplace
We are technology partners who help the business transform how our employees around the world work
We have an inclusive and collaborative working environment that encourages creativity, curiosity, and celebrates success!
You'll get to work with and learn from diverse industry leaders, who have hailed from top technology companies around the world
We foster an environment of innovation and continuous learning
We care about our people, allowing them to design how they work to deliver amazing results
We offer a competitive total rewards package, including a performance bonus, company matching programs (on pension & profit sharing), and generous vacation
Scotiabank
As Canada's International Bank, we are a diverse and global team. We speak more than 100 languages with backgrounds from more than 120 countries. We value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the Bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. If you require technical assistance please click here. Candidates must apply directly online to be considered for this role. We thank all applicants for their interest in a career at Scotiabank; however, only those candidates who are selected for an interview will be contacted.
Is this Role not the Exact fit?
Sign up to stay in touch; we’ll let you know when we have new positions on the team.

Title: Environmental Data Analyst - Flow Monitoring
Desc: Incorporated in 2008, AMG Environmental Inc. provides storm water and sewer flow monitoring services for clients such as municipalities, water districts and housing development companies. AMG offers specialized technical field services, flow monitoring data collection and data management services in order to provide its clients with essential data used to identify and resolve sewer capacity and flow issues. AMG Environmental also partners with engineering firms to develop customized sewer solutions based on the data collected and analyzed by the AMG team.DescriptionThe Data Analyst, under the direction of the Manager of Environmental Data Services, is responsible for the quality of environmental monitoring data. Primarily, the Data Analyst will use internal web-based analysis tools such as hydrographs, time series data plots, scatter graphs and field reports to analyze trends and interpret results of environmental flow monitoring projects. They will also be required to perform necessary data repairs and schedule field crew maintenance on equipment. Prior experience with flow monitoring, inflow/infiltration studies, open-channel flow hydraulics or wastewater systems would be beneficial. The Data Analyst must possess a degree or diploma in a related field and three years of related experience.Job DutiesAssist in collection and tracking of data from a variety of different sensors (depth, velocity, temperature, pH, H2S, turbidity, DO, rain gauges etc.)Daily review and processing of data using web-based statistical software – analyzing trends and interpreting the resultsPerform daily data evaluation, maintenance and data repairs (i.e. after sensor calibrations)Prioritize and efficiently schedule field crews for routine site maintenanceCreate and submit work orders with a high degree of accuracy and professionalismInteract with field personnel, production personnel, engineers, and clients on scheduling and data quality related issuesAct as a technical consultant and provide customer service through various means including telecommunications, internet research and database systemsPrepare reports, research papers and educational textsGenerate flow balancing spreadsheets and other related documents as needed for assessing data qualityActively participate in company quality management systems and QA/QC procedures; including internal audits, root cause analysis and corrective actionsContribute to the development of new projects and ideasMaintain a safe working environmentJob RequirementsDegree or diploma in environmental studies or a related fieldThree years of related work experience is considered an assetProficient in Microsoft Excel, Microsoft Word and Microsoft OutlookAbility to understand and accurately interpret data qualityProven ability to analyze complex information and conduct relevant research to identify underlying principles, reasons, or factsKnowledge of GIS (Geographic Information System) and other statistical software is considered an asset, but not requiredExperience with SQL databases is considered an asset, but not requiredCompetenciesDetail orientedStrong organization & time management skillsProject coordinationExcellent problem-solving skillsEffective communication & listeningAbility to work individually as well as part of a teamCommitment to Health and SafetyContinuous ImprovementWork ConditionsNearly always work indoorsSafe ergonomic operation of desktop computer and peripheralsAttendance and participation in trainingUse of required personal protective equipmentEqual Opportunity EmployerAMG Environmental Inc. is committed to providing a barrier-free work environment in concert with the Accessibility for Ontarian's with Disabilities Act and the Ontario Human Rights Code. As such, AMG Environmental Inc. will make accommodations available to applicants with disabilities upon request during the recruitment process.AMG Environmental Inc. is an equal opportunity employer and strives to ensure that its hiring process meets the needs of all persons with disabilities. As such, AMG Environmental Inc. will provide reasonable accommodation for any applicant, as requested during the hiring process.AMG Environmental Inc. seeks to fully integrate the principles of Employment Equity and will ensure the full participation and advancement of members of historically disadvantaged groups (i.e., members of visible minorities, persons with disabilities, women, and aboriginal peoples). AMG Environmental Inc. will achieve this by ensuring that its hiring process is fair and equitable for all persons.AMG Environmental Inc. strives to ensure that its employment practices are free from direct and indirect discrimination and is committed to upholding the human rights of those participating in the hiring process. In pursuit of this commitment, AMG Environmental Inc. will not condone or tolerate any acts of discrimination or harassment under any of the grounds protected under human rights legislation. This commitment extends to the hiring process and throughout the course of employment.Job Type: Full-timeSalary: $42,000.00-$50,000.00 per yearBenefits:Company eventsDental careLife insuranceOn-site parkingPaid time offVision careWork from homeSchedule:8 hour shiftMonday to FridayNo weekendsCOVID-19 considerations:A COVID-19 Safe Work Plan has been developed that includes mandatory daily screening, physical distancing, and masks to be worn when required.Ability to commute/relocate:Barrie, ON L4N 9J5: reliably commute or plan to relocate before starting work (required)Experience:environmental: 1 year (required)Language:English (required)

Title: Senior Analyst, Data Sensitivity & Ethics
Desc:
Requisition ID: 148221

Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.
Purpose:
The CIDA team at Scotiabank is at the forefront of the journey to transform the Bank into a data centric organization through impactful customer insights, innovative analytics, and well governed data. One of the main areas of transformation is the way data is used, shared, and accessed at an enterprise level. The aim is to provide transparent, robust, and ethical data practices across the enterprise to enhance the protection of our customers’ data, and the way we deliver business value. We are looking to build our delivery team with influencers, makers, creators, and industry leaders who will drive us forward.
The role of the Senior Analyst, Data Ethics Governance & Operations will be responsible for:
Enabling the Bank’s adoption of the Data Ethics Framework with a Global scope
Supporting, facilitating, and monitoring the organization’s efforts to adhere to the Data Ethics Framework
Supporting day-to-day BAU operations of the team (reporting, metric/KPI/Audit tracking, etc,).
We are looking for someone who will make key contributions in developing, planning, and executing the adoption of processes and tools that enable ethical data use, third party data sharing frameworks, and streamlining data access rights. This role will work closely with our legal, privacy, data office, analytics, and technology teams in the bank to design, develop, and execute processes for the ethical use of data.
Accountabilities:
Work closely with representatives across the bank to ensure all activities are conducted in compliance with internal policies & procedures and governing regulations
Data Sensitivity reviews: to determine the level of protection required for data that is moving within the bank, including in cloud technology)
Ethics Assistant: to provide ethical guidance and oversight to AI/ML use cases
Data Ethics Impact Assessments: to provide ethical guidance for data initiatives
Ensure business stakeholder understanding, alignment and commitment to the objectives of the data ethics framework
Develop strong working relationships with partners across the organization, to ensure consistency and alignment on best practices
Review business stakeholders’ implementation of data ethics framework for quality assurance and compliance
Document and maintain operational procedures for data ethics processes and practices.
Track and report on process performance and adherence, identifying areas of improvement and recommending practical and innovative solutions
Develop subject matter expertise on enterprise data sensitivity and update procedural artifacts in the Data Office and related stakeholders
Contribute to the remediation and closure of audit issues within stipulated deadlines
Participate in planning and retrospective sessions, attend stand-ups, etc. - we work in an agile environment
Functional Competencies:
2+ years of experience in business/financial services
Practical experience in data management, privacy, risk/compliance, or related areas in a cross-functional environment of multiple data sources & repositories
Experience with data governance and data quality tools (e.g. Collibra, Informatica DQ) is an asset
Thorough knowledge of data governance, privacy, and risk management processes, concepts, and controls is an asset
Spanish language skills is an asset
Strong communication skills, both written and spoken – delivering clear requests for information and communicating potential conflicts
Strong interpersonal skills, able to effectively build relationships and collaborate with partners
Able to work independently and act with good judgement, demonstrating creativity and perseverance in problem solving
Results orientation and pragmatic approach to decision making
Self-motivated, solution driven individual and adaptable to a fast-paced environment
Location(s): Canada : Ontario : Toronto

Scotiabank is a leading bank in the Americas. Guided by our purpose: "for every future", we help our customers, their families and their communities achieve success through a broad range of advice, products and services, including personal and commercial banking, wealth management and private banking, corporate and investment banking, and capital markets.

At Scotiabank, we value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the Bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. Candidates must apply directly online to be considered for this role. We thank all applicants for their interest in a career at Scotiabank; however, only those candidates who are selected for an interview will be contacted.

Title: Business Analyst
Desc:

Total Credit Recovery Limited (TCR) is the largest Canadian-owned receivables management company, servicing most major Canadian credit grantors. TCR is a progressive company, with over 600 employees in 4 offices across the country.

Title: Data Analyst – Team Lead
Desc:
Ledcor Employee? Apply internally in Workday.
Description
Job Summary:
You're a Data Analyst with experience analyzing, documenting and implementing business system and reporting improvements as identified and prioritized by your business. You will ideally have past experience with requirements gathering, documentation, and key elements software testing as it relates to business systems and reporting. In this role, you may also identify, assess, and present continuous improvement opportunities as discovered through requirements gathering, training sessions, Tier 2/3 support on system functionality, and through other relationship channels and stakeholder communications.


Join our True Blue team in Vancouver, BC or Calgary, AB today!
Essential Responsibilities
Liaise with stakeholders to elicit, interpret, and validate requirements for development of business system and reporting functionality.
Document and present requirements via system and reporting design specifications and as-built documentation, including business case presentations/recommendations for new improvement opportunities
Perform unit and integration testing on system and reporting development, including User Acceptance Testing sessions to obtain stakeholder approval
Facilitate system implementation and data migration tasks in support of project management milestones
Provide ongoing end-user scheduled training, and train the trainer sessions/communications for new system and reporting releases
Assist with the team’s Scrum activities including facilitating stand-ups, sprint planning, sprint reviews, and burndown/board reporting
Provide Tier 2/3 support on business systems and reporting
Guide a small team of data analyst on day to day and long term projects
Qualifications
3 – 5 years of experience as a business systems analyst, or data analyst with proven communication and project management skills
2 – 3 years of experience designing operational database pipelines involving 3rd party apps, including low-code platforms such as QuickBase
3 years of experience with Python, SQL, and PowerShell scripting
Experience in a Scrum agile project management environment preferred
Expert knowledge of business systems and reporting best practices; ability to translate business requirements into robust system and reporting design specifications
Familiarity with data modelling concepts and RDBMS best practices
Telecommunications industry experience, particularly in engineering or construction operations
Work Conditions
Home and office based position
Additional Information:
Company Description
Ledcor Technical Services (LTS) designs, builds, and maintains wireline or wireless networks that span North America and beyond. We are a proven leader and innovator in telecommunications network construction, maintenance, and service installation and repair.
But when you work for Ledcor, your experience will go far beyond the project. Do you want a career that means more? Join our True Blue team now!
Employment Equity
At Ledcor we believe diversity, equity, and inclusion should be part of everything we do. We are proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. All qualified individuals, regardless of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or any other identifying characteristic are encouraged to apply.
Our True Blue team consists of individuals from all backgrounds who contribute diverse perspectives and experiences to Ledcor. We are committed to continuing to build on our culture of empowerment, inclusion and belonging.
View our full Inclusion & Diversity statement here.

Title: Channels Analyst
Desc:
Address:
55 Bloor Street West
Job Family Group:
Data Analytics & Reporting
Description
The Channels Analyst is responsible for developing automated, scalable reporting and analytics solutions for Canadian P&BB. This position will support omni-channel analytics through delivery of reporting, insights and measurement in line with Enterprise strategy and Digital Acceleration.
The incumbent will act as reporting and analytics subject matter expert for the Digital Channels portfolio while also supporting NACCC, combining both business and technology acumen to generate and maintain reporting in various forms (ad-hoc analyses, data visualization, self-serve BI).
Specific Accountabilities
Build Power BI Dashboards from scratch and maintain existing reporting
Data curation – extracting data from multiple sources, manipulating and validation using database tools. Must have SAS, SQL skills and experience
Identify, analyze and interprets trends of patterns in complex data set. Analyze data to drive business decisions and actionable recommendations
Assimilate and analyze information from a variety of sources, make recommendations and present information in an easy and understandable manner
Develop in-depth understanding of BMO data and systems (IDP, CAD, CDW, Adobe)
Comfortable with ambiguity – self-learner able to independently navigate complex data
Work proactively and collaboratively with key clients and stakeholders to continuously enhance reporting
Quality check key deliverables, ensuring they are delivered accurately and to the highest quality
Qualifications
The ideal candidate will have the following:
3+ years experience in business intelligence/ ETL, analytics
3+ years experience in Finance industry
Strong experience within data preparation, data analysis, and statistical tool sets including but not limited to SQL, SAS, R/Python
Experience implementing data visualization (Power BI, Spotfire, Tableau)
Strong logical thinking, analytical and problem solving skills;
Willingness to learn and being curious;
Ability to perform on multiple projects simultaneously and deliver under tight timelines Experience with BMO data and familiarity with BMO products and operations
Requirements
A university degree in mathematics, statistics, economics, econometrics, engineering, computer science, physics
We’re here to help
At BMO we are driven by a shared Purpose: Boldly Grow the Good in business and life. It calls on us to create lasting, positive change for our customers, our communities and our people. By working together, innovating and pushing boundaries, we transform lives and businesses, and power economic growth around the world.
As a member of the BMO team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. We strive to help you make an impact from day one – for yourself and our customers. We’ll support you with the tools and resources you need to reach new milestones, as you help our customers reach theirs. From in-depth training and coaching, to manager support and network-building opportunities, we’ll help you gain valuable experience, and broaden your skillset.
To find out more visit us at https://jobs.bmo.com/ca/en .
BMO is committed to an inclusive, equitable and accessible workplace. By learning from each other’s differences, we gain strength through our people and our perspectives. Title: Business Systems Analyst
Desc:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.
Job Title
Business Systems Analyst
Job Description
What will you do?
Elicit functional and system requirements for Registrations Compliance projects for Capital Markets and Wealth Management
Develop plans and accurate estimates for completion of requirements, continuously improving the level of details and accuracy of estimates
Analyze and document detailed business and system solution requirements using Agile methodology
Define practical user experiences, including storytelling, personas, process flows and interactions
Build and maintain a repository of reusable requirements documentation to support future initiatives, following the enterprise standards
Apply advanced coverage analysis techniques to ensure relationship between scope, detailed requirements, and testing through to implementation
Contribute to successful project completion within budget and on time by identifying risks and developing/recommending mitigation strategies.
What do you need to succeed?
Must-have
3-5 years fulfilling both Business Analyst and/or Business System Analyst roles
Proficiency in Agile Methodology Framework
Expertise in gathering, analyzing and documenting User Stories, Use Cases, workflow diagrams, and E2E requirements
Experience with requirements elicitation techniques such as Document Analysis, Interviews, Facilitated Workshops, Observation, Prototyping, Focus groups, Surveys
Experience in working with large projects with multiple stakeholders, data sources and system interfaces
Ability to communicates and build relationship with team members, stakeholders and business partners in order to complete deliverables.
Experience in generating new and effective ideas, approaches and solutions to complex problems & opportunities; openly question traditional assumptions track and manage changes to requirements throughout the project life cycle
Familiarity with relational databases, and query languages
Nice-to-have
Good understanding of capital markets, registrations and licensing compliance is an asset.
Knowledge of North American and international securities trading and data related to complete trade life cycle.
Experience with JIRA, and Confluence
