Title: Analyst/Administrative Assistant
Desc:
Job Description: 
  


Job Title: 


     Analyst/Administrative Assistant
    




 Work Site: 


     Community Health-NS-Central Es
    




 Status:


 Start Date:


 Hours:





 Regular Full Time
     

       As soon as possible
     

       0830-1630
     

       Days off: Saturday, Sunday, Statutory Holidays
     




 Salary: 


     $25.63 - $33.64 per hour
    




 Reference#: 


     162271-ayc
    



 Come work as an Analyst/Administrative Assistant with Vancouver Coastal Health (VCH)!   Vancouver Coastal Health is looking for an Analyst/Administrative Assistant to join the Medical Hlth Officer (NS Comm) team. Apply today to join our team!

 As an Analyst/Administrative Assistant with Vancouver Coastal Health you will:

 Provide analytical support to the ‘content area’ team for purposes such as data analysis, statistical reporting, benchmarking activities, developing and generating queries, preparing and compiling reports and technical documents utilizing various software and tools.
 Provide confidential administrative and secretarial assistance and research support to the Executive Director, ‘content area’ and to the ‘content area’ team.
 Maintain the Executive Director’s and management team’s appointment calendars, coordinates meetings, processes and prioritizes information, screens, triages and acts upon requests and inquiries, including confidential and sensitive information.
 Work independently and interfaces with other Executive Directors, Managers and staff at all levels of the organization.
 Effectively partner with other VCH departments such as the Decision Support team and liaises on behalf of the department with external agencies to coordinate the flow of information, keeping the Executive Director apprised of relevant issues and activities.


 QUALIFICATIONS:



 Education & Experience


 Diploma in a related program plus three to four (3-4) years' recent, related experience in a complex health care environment with progressively more responsible secretarial and administrative positions supporting senior level management, experience in information analysis and benchmarking, or an equivalent combination of education, training and experience.
 Advanced computer skills in spreadsheet, database, graphics and word processing programs is required, e.g. Microsoft Excel, Access, PowerPoint, Word, and Visio.


 Knowledge & Abilities


 Employs expertise in the use of desktop computer applications to create a variety of documents, reports and presentations, and to maintain databases.
 Applies acquired skills and knowledge to efficiently and independently resolve administrative issues/problems. 
Effectively utilizes both verbal and written communication skills when providing advice or information or seeking/acquiring information.
 Optimizes departmental effectiveness and contributes to organizational success by applying excellent time management skills to prioritize and complete assignments and schedule activities.
 Practices diligence and care when maintaining, monitoring, calculating and summarizing data, records and budget information.


 As per the current Public Health Orders (Long Term Care/Seniors Assisted Living Provincial Health Officer Order and the Health Sector Order), as of October 26, 2021, all employees working for Vancouver Coastal Health must be fully vaccinated for COVID-19. Proof of vaccination status will be required.


 WHY JOIN VANCOUVER COASTAL HEALTH?



 VCH is a world class innovator in medical care, research and teaching, delivering service to more than one million BC residents. At VCH, we embrace thinking boldly, taking smart risks, and "going first" when we believe it will lead to the best possible outcomes for patients and their families. We invite you to join us in creating healthy lives in healthy communities by showcasing our passion for care, connection to the communities we serve and our culture of teamwork that makes VCH a great place to work.
  

 Comprehensive health benefits package, including MSP, extended health and dental and municipal pension plan
 Grow your career with employer-paid training and leadership development opportunities
 Wellness supports, including counselling, critical incident and innovative wellness services are available to employees and their immediate families
 Award-winning recognition programs to honour staff, medical staff and volunteers
 Access to exclusive discount offers and deals for VCH staff


    Diversity, equity, and inclusion are essential to our goals of creating a great place to work and delivering exceptional care. We acknowledge and accommodate unique differences and ensure special measures are in place so that all prospective and current employees are given an opportunity to succeed.
   
 We are committed to building a representative workforce and encourage applications reflecting diversity of sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, racialization or ancestry, disability, political belief, religion, marital or family status, age, and/or status as a First Nation, Metis, Inuit, or Indigenous person.
   
 Vancouver Coastal Health is proud to be recognized as one of Canada's Top 100 Employers in 2022.
  


 Please note that a resume is required to apply to this posting.
   
 Hours of Work may vary due to project requirements.
   

Only short-listed applicants will be contacted for this posting.



 ***Employees of VCH must apply via the 
   Internal Application Process. Refer to the 
   https://my.vch.ca/working-here/job-postings site for 
   How to Apply instructions. Current VCH employees who apply to this posting using this external site will be considered as an external candidate. Seniority will not apply.***
   
 Thank you for your interest in Vancouver Coastal Health.

Title: Transfer Pricing Analyst
Desc:
Putting people first, every day:

BDO is a firm built on a foundation of positive relationships with our people and our clients. Each day, we rely on our professionals to provide exceptional service, and help our clients by providing advice and insight they can trust. In turn, we offer an environment that fosters a people-first culture with a high priority on your personal and professional growth.
Your opportunity:

Our Vancouver office is looking for an Analyst to join the Transfer Pricing Tax team and own the below responsibilities. This is an excellent opportunity to dive into analytical research towards valuating inter-company international transactions within a varied client base with a collaborative team.
Reviewing, benchmarking and analyzing cross-border intercompany transactions between related enterprises within multinational corporate groups.
Performs complex analysis of economic and business quantitative and qualitative data.
Prepares reports of summarized findings in order to facilitate client presentations with Senior staff.
Collaborates within the team within a client-centric environment.
Preparing presentations with significant analytical data within specified format.
Effectively communicate with team members regarding progress updates on an ongoing basis.
How do we define success for your role?
You will understand the industries BDO services and contribute to the group's advancement.
You will ensure work is complete, accurate and appropriately reviewed by maintaining the necessary technical knowledge and professional development.
You will recommend and implement quality or efficiency improvements to our engagements.
You will actively engage in communication with people leaders to ensure understanding of performance and development, while identifying and attracting top talent.
You will support our firm's revenue growth by referring clients to other services lines and new clients to BDO.
Your experience and education
Excellent writing and technical research skills are necessary
You have completed a university degree with a major in Economics, Finance, Accounting or Business.
You have experience within a professional services environment either supporting Transfer Pricing engagements or compiling & presenting complex analytical data.
You enjoy working within a collaborative team within a deadline-oriented environment.
You display strong problem solving, analytical, and communication skills.
Why BDO?
Our firm is committed to providing an environment where you can be successful in the following ways:
We enable you to engage with the firm's strategic plan, and be a key contributor to the success and growth of the firm.
We help you be the best professional you can be in our services, industries and markets.
Achieve your personal goals outside of the office and make an impact on your community.
Giving back, it adds up: Where company meets community. BDO is actively involved in our communities by supporting local charity initiatives. We support staff with local and national events where you will be given the opportunity to contribute to your community.

Total rewards that matter: We pay for performance with competitive total cash compensation that recognizes and rewards your contribution. We provide flexible benefits from day one, and a market leading personal time off policy. We are committed to supporting your overall wellness beyond working hours, and provide reimbursement for wellness initiatives that fit your lifestyle.

Everyone counts: We believe every employee should have the opportunity to participate and succeed. Through leadership by our Chief Inclusion and Diversity Officer, we are committed to a workplace culture of respect, inclusion, and diversity. We recognize and celebrate the valuable differences among each of us, including race, religious beliefs, physical or mental disabilities, age, place of origin, marital status, family status, gender or gender identity and sexual orientation. If you require accommodation to complete the application process, please contact us.
As a hybrid workplace, all BDO personnel are expected to spend some of their time working in the office, at the client and remotely unless accommodations or alternative work arrangements are in place. To protect the health and safety of our people, clients and communities, we require all partners and employees to be COVID-19 fully vaccinated in order to enter a BDO office. Individuals that cannot be fully vaccinated with a Health Canada approved vaccine due to medical reasons or another protected ground under Human Rights legislation may request an accommodation.


Ready to make your mark at BDO? Click “Apply now” to send your up-to-date resume to one of our Talent Acquisition Specialists.

To explore other opportunities at BDO, check out our careers page.
 #LI-AD2

Title: Energy Analyst
Desc:
Posted
08-Apr-2022
Service line
GWS Segment
Role type
Full-time
Areas of Interest
Data & Analytics
Location(s)
Toronto - Ontario - Canada
Responsibilities
 Oversee the bill administration process for existing utility accounts ensuring consumption & cost data are tracked accurately for the purposes of energy management and reporting. Act as the primary contact between CBRE & utility companies Maintain & update energy dashboards using Tableau Assist with ongoing monthly reporting requirements of the Energy Analytics team. Develop new and maintain existing reports and handle data requests from internal and external stakeholders (examples of reports include utility consumption in common units and ekWh, annual Greenhouse Gas accounting, and portfolio benchmarking).
 Assist in the development of utility budgets and explain financial variances.
 Assist with preparation of material & presentation of monthly energy analytics to the regional building teams. Assist with Ontario government’s ICIP (Class A) program. Support training initiatives for internal and external clients
 Engagement with building tenants via sustainability events and newsletters as required. Assist with other ad-hoc projects & client request.
Minimum Qualifications
Post-secondary degree/diploma in finance, engineering, mathematics, science or related fields
Advanced Excel skills – experience with formulas and pivot tables
Knowledge & experience of Tableau & Tableau Prep Builder.
Energy and Sustainability experience (academic, professional/volunteer experience)
Excellent communication skills
Basic understanding of relation databases and SQL
 Preferred Qualifications
Utility experience is an asset – worked at a utility, energy market regulator, or energy consultant company
Familiarity with utility invoices (e.g. power factor, energy rate classes, etc.)
Working knowledge of Energy Star Portfolio Manager, International Performance Measurement and Verification Protocol (IPMVP) Framework, and either LEED or boma BEST
Accounting experience – knowledge of accruals, budget/reforecast, and variance analysis
Experience with Tableau Prep Conductor or Power Query
Experience with Tableau Desktop or Microsoft PowerBI
Programming experience with Python
Experience with Microsoft Teams and Sharepoint

Title: Capital & Maintenance Program Analyst
Desc:
WORK ILLUSTRATION:
The Capital and Maintenance Program Analyst is responsible for the effective business operations associated with Toronto Hydro-Electric Systems Limited (THESL) Capital and Maintenance programs and operating expenses. Responsibilities include: data gathering, data analysis, identifying gaps and trends as well as producing reports related to the THESL Capital and Maintenance Work Programs. The incumbent will develop processes, procedures and tools to ensure governance and compliance in the delivery of the THESL Capital and Maintenance Execution Work Program. The Analyst will also develop databases and automated reports to assist leaders and external stakeholders in the efficient and effective management of the capital work programs.

The incumbent is expected to behave ethically and follow the established code of business conduct, policies and internal control procedures, laws and regulations governing Toronto Hydro.

Toronto Hydro has implemented a mandatory vaccination requirement for all its employees. Proof of full vaccination will be required upon receiving a conditional offer of employment. Toronto Hydro will provide reasonable accommodation to individuals who cannot be vaccinated due to disability or any other ground protected by the Ontario Human Rights Code.
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:
Analysis of gaps and trends for various projects/ programs.
Prepares reports pertaining to project/program status and outcomes.
Manage performance of contractors
Identifies gaps and trends and performs analyses to determine root causes and develops recommended solutions.
Gathers data, performs data analysis and creates reports ensuring accuracy of data.
Leads and participates in process improvement initiatives as well as process mapping activities in support of departmental continuous improvement programs.
Liaises with internal and external stakeholders to assist in the successful coordination and delivery of project/ execution.
Creates and maintains reporting applications, forms and customized databases.
Performs periodic analysis and monitoring of operations data for the purposes of quality assurance.
Participates in corporate wide initiatives to support overall business strategy.
Supports the development of rate applications to the regulator including, preparation of narratives, assisting with responses to interrogatories and supporting witness preparation needs related to THESL Capital/Maintenance Execution Work Programs.

COMPETENCIES:
Bachelor degree in Engineering (Electrical Engineering preferred).
Five (5) plus years’ of experience in data analysis, gap analysis and reporting results.
Five (5) plus years' of experience in business process redesign, analysis for business projects, identification areas for improvement and development of new initiatives.
Two (2) or more years of experience in construction project environment.
Class G license required.
Familiarity with SAP enterprise modules is an asset.
Project/program management experience preferred.
Certified Business Analyst Professional (CBAP) designation is an asset.
Project Management Professional (PMP) designation is an asset.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Excellent analytical and business solution development skills, including the proven ability to function effectively in a dynamic environment.
Fully proficient in the use of Microsoft Office applications including advanced working knowledge in MS Excel, MS Project, MS Access and MS Word.
Able to proactively flag At-Risk areas of business based on analysis of data and KPIs.
Ability to develop statistical tracking methodologies to track performance and measurement against set standards of quality.
Ability to develop dependable feedback systems and tracking.
Experience with process mapping and procedure writing.
Knowledge of Microsoft programming languages (such as VBA or SQL) to support data analytics is an asset.
Business and strategic thinking acumen.

Job Segment: Programmer, Engineer, ERP, Electrical, Program Manager, Technology, Engineering, Management

Title: Intern Business Analyst
Desc:
CONTRACT TYPE
Internship
PUBLICATION DATE
2022-03-07
COUNTRY
Canada
Company presentation

A world leader in gases, technologies and services for Industry and Health, Air Liquide is present in 78 countries with approximately 64,500 employees and serves more than 3.8 million customers and patients. Oxygen, nitrogen and hydrogen are essential small molecules for life, matter and energy. They embody Air Liquide’s scientific territory and have been at the core of the company’s activities since its creation in 1902.

Entity and activity description

Air Liquide’s ambition is to be a leader in its industry, deliver long term performance and contribute to sustainability - with a strong commitment to climate change and energy transition at the heart of its strategy. The company’s customer-centric transformation strategy aims at profitable, regular and responsible growth over the long term. It relies on operational excellence, selective investments, open innovation and a network organization implemented by the Group worldwide. Through the commitment and inventiveness of its people, Air Liquide leverages energy and environment transition, changes in healthcare and digitization, and delivers greater value to all its stakeholders.

Air Liquide’s revenue amounted to more than 20 billion euros in 2020. Air Liquide is listed on the Euronext Paris stock exchange (compartment A) and belongs to the CAC 40, EURO STOXX 50 and FTSE4Good indexes
Missions and Responsibilities

We are currently looking for an Intern in Customer success and Commercial team. CPQ (Configure Price Quote) is an Oracle Commerce Cloud hosted application used by our sales teams to provide digital quotes to our customers.


Your challenges at Air Liquide

Support users on the tool and identify enhancements & bugs to be corrected .
Contribute to the various phases of development and data lifecycle: design, data modeling, testing, tuning, deployment and monitoring.
Update marketing dashboard in Power BI for KPIs follow-up
Interact with technical teams to address issues reported by users.

Competencies and Profile

Who are we looking for?

You are a bachelor's (3rd or 4th year), master's, or doctoral student in computer science, mathematics, statistics, or a related field.
You have experience with Python.
You are recognized by your analytical and problem-solving skills.
You have excellent learning skills.
You have an interest in digital marketing
You agree to disclose your COVID-19 vaccination status as a condition of employment.
You agree to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 and to maintain full vaccination status as a condition of employment.

Additional information

It would be great if

You are familiar with any of the providers: Azure, AWS, Oracle, Power BI & Google.
You are able to communicate orally and in writing in both French and English.


At Air Liquide, we value the health and safety of our customers, patients and employees. As such, we strongly encourage everyone to be vaccinated against COVID-19 and all future employees will be required to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 and maintain full vaccination status.

Title: Student Experience Analyst
Desc:
Land Acknowledgement
George Brown College is located on the traditional territory of the Mississaugas of the Credit First Nation and other Indigenous peoples who have lived here over time. We are grateful to share this land as treaty people who learn, work, and live in the community with each other.
At George Brown College, we have established a reputation for equipping our students with the skills, industry experience and credentials to pursue the careers of their choice. As employees, we are committed to creating an enriching learning community for our students, delivering excellence in what we do, holding ourselves accountable for our work and demonstrating diversity and respect for one another.
What responsibilities will you have in this role?
Develops and compiles process documentation by creating detailed and overview process maps for the division.
Recommends changes to operational policies, procedures and processes and consulting with relevant subject matter experts and management to implement changes.
Analyzes data to support Key Service Indicators as set out for the division.
Creates and maintains manuals and online staff training materials or online training modules resulting from changes.
Gathers data using one of the following methods: design and administering surveys; organizing and facilitating focus groups; one-on-one or group interviews with students or staff as needed.
Improves current data collection activities in service areas that will provide greater insight to impacts on student success retention rates.
Develops surveys and reporting for service feedback and student engagement for the Division using Campus Labs or other tool.
Provides systems support and administration for applications managed by the Contact Centre and Student Success Hubs.
Troubleshoots technical support for Contact Centre team relating to the access and functionality of any of our applications.
Monitors and maintains all aspects of the Knowledgebase system to ensure functionality and performance is optimized.
Collaborates with internal stakeholders and Knowledgebase vendor to implement any new features to increase utilization for self-service.
Co-ordinates business requirements with other project team members to ensure our student experience goals are being met as it may relate to future projects or upgrades: knowledgebase, CRM, chatbot, live chat, and Contact Centre software and agent applications.
Develops and tests IVR scripts for outbound call campaigns and enhancements for the Contact Centre or other stakeholders.
Works collaboratively with ITS and external service providers in regards to software, databases and software development and troubleshooting.
Assesses new technology for use in the Student Success Division and the Student Success Hub and provide recommendations to management for its appropriate usability or the business area.
Contributes to the development of project briefs and detailed project plans.
Participates in departmental and college wide projects related to student service and enhancing the student experience.
Provides trend analysis, student service data and technical expertise to the project team.
Other duties as assigned.
What qualifications do you need for this role?
Three-year diploma or degree or equivalent from a recognized post-secondary institution in Information systems, statistics, computer sciences, business administration.
Current CompTIA A+ Plus Certification (industry standard exam) is required.
Minimum five (5) years experience related to information systems in an analyst position or similar information processing environment.
Advanced knowledge and experience using Adobe Creative Tools and MS Office; programming includes Java, HTML and CSS.
Technical knowledge to diagnose and resolve end user devices (computers and printers) and standard software issues correctly and quickly.
Experience providing technical support in the diagnosis and resolution of all types of recurrent and uncommon problems associated with the Customer Flow Management system.
Scripting skills for Cisco IVR outbound call campaigns.
Prior Business analysis experience gathering, documenting, and communicating stakeholder requirements to effectively recommend and evaluate solutions and provide quality assurance.
Experience with developing programming within an institutional environment involving a broad range of stakeholders, both internal and external.
Experience with managing, reporting, and data collection.
Strong ability to create clear and concise reports based on a variety of data.
Experience facilitating conflict resolution.
Demonstrated excellent communication, collaboration, teamwork, people skills, interpersonal, negotiation and problem-solving skills; high level of tact and diplomacy.
Excellent organizational, planning, coordinating, and multi-tasking skills with demonstrated ability to manage the delivery of numerous complex and demanding tasks and competing deadlines. Ability to assign tasks and set priorities.
Demonstrated commitment in delivering excellent service to others - key in supporting the success of our students and College.
Effective ability to interact with others and deal with situations in ways that respect diverse backgrounds, experience and styles.
Flexibility in adapting to change and in participating in consultative decision-making processes.

Hours of Work: Monday – Friday 8:30 am – 4:30 pm

Interview process may consist of a practical skills component.
TO APPLY:
If you are a George Brown College employee, click here to apply via our internal site.
If you are an external candidate, go to www.georgebrown.ca and click on the “Employment at George Brown” link or click on the ‘apply’ button to the left of the posted job to apply.
NOTES:
Please ensure your resume highlights all relevant education, training and experience that are applicable to the minimum qualifications for this role.
The College requires proof of degrees, credentials or equivalencies from accredited regional or federal post-secondary institutions and/or their international equivalents. Credentials may require validation at the time of interviews.
First consideration will be provided to internal candidates in accordance with our Support Staff Collective Agreement.
Closing: April 15, 2023
George Brown College is committed to creating and sustaining an equitable and inclusive learning and working environment. We encourage and actively seek applications from Indigenous, Black, racialized people, visible minorities, 2SLGBTQIA+ persons, all genders, and persons with disabilities. George Brown College is committed to accommodating applicants with disabilities throughout the hiring process, in accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act (AODA). The Human Resources representative responsible for the recruitment for this position will work with applicants requesting accommodation at any stage of the hiring process. Candidates who require accommodation in the interview process may contact talentacquisition@georgebrown.ca and all information received will be addressed confidentially.
As a unionized workplace, we support our internal employees by providing first consideration to qualified applications as set out in the Collective Agreement.
For information on George Brown College, please visit our website at www.georgebrown.ca.

Title: Cognos BI Developer
Desc:
About big river technologies

 We are seasoned industry veterans with decades of experience in capital markets technology and delivery excellence. We created big river technologies to be the boutique customer-centric firm we always wanted to work for, truly focused on client success. Headquartered in Gananoque, in the heart of the beautiful 1000 Islands region of Eastern Ontario and with office in New York City, we work for some of the world’s largest and most successful financial organizations and software vendors. Our Business-Driven Development methodology ensures projects are delivered on time & budget. We have three core practices: FinTech, user experience discovery, and enterprise computing. Our work spans end-to-end solution development including ideation, architecture, design, software development, quality assurance and overall delivery. We’re passionate about what we do. Come join us, you will thrive.

 As a Cognos BI Developer you will assist with the development of reports for New Product Approval (NPA) Platform and GRC Data Warehouse using IBM Cognos. You will be a member of the GRC Analytics team that designs, develops, and implements reporting solutions on the NPA GRC Platform and GRC Reporting Data Warehouse. You will interact directly with internal business clients to understand their reporting, analytics & data needs, design business intelligence solutions, and work with other members on the team (data modelers, report authors, ETL developers, data analysts, etc.) on the implementation of such solutions. This includes the development of detailed list reports, crosstab reports, senior management dashboards, and integration reports.

 
You will also be responsible for the development of Cognos Framework Manager models, reporting fragments, and notifications using IBM Cognos Analytics (v.11).

To develop detailed list reports, crosstab reports, senior management dashboards, and integration reports using Cognos Analytics (v. 11).
To develop data triggered notifications for the NPA Platform using Cognos Event Studio.
To develop and maintain Cognos Framework Manager models for the GRC Reporting Data Warehouse.
To assist and provide guidance to ETL & data warehouse developers with complex ETLs, stored procedures, triggers, MQTs and views on our DB2-based Data Warehouse necessary for reporting purposes
To provide guidance to other development team members, and validate and verify deliverables before migration to QA, UAT and Production.
To provide assistance and guidance during the QA, UAT, and Production stages to quickly confirm the validity of potential issues and to determine the root cause and best resolution of verified issues



 Required skills:

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Information Technology, or related field required 
At least 5+ years of experience as a Cognos BI Developer.
A strong understanding of Cognos Analytics v11 architecture and report development.
A strong understanding of Cognos Framework Manager modeling, including the design of DMR and business user friendly models.
Experience with the performance testing of Cognos reports and the ability to quickly identify and resolve performance issues.
Strong understanding of advanced data warehouse concepts (Factless Fact Tables, Temporal \ BI-Temporal models, etc.)
Well versed in writing complex, yet efficient SQL code, especially in a DB2 environment.
Effective communication and presentation skills.
Excellent collaboration and team skills.



 Other Desired Skills:

Experience using the Cognos Java SDK.
Experience with writing JavaScript and using it to extend the functionality of Cognos Report Studio.
Experience with the Cognos Microsoft Office plug-in. 
Domain knowledge of risk, compliance and audit a plus.
Experience with other BI applications like Tableau a plus
Experience with Tibco Virtual Data Platform (previously known as Composite) a plus
Experience with NoSQL databases such as MarkLogic a plus
Experience with Agile development practices
Strong analytical and design skills, including the ability to understand business requirements and translate them into efficient and effective technical designs that work well within large-scale, well-structured enterprise environments.
Excellent trouble-shooting skills, with the ability to quickly identify and document the root cause of issues, and effectively communicate possible resolutions.



 Work Related Expectations

 For this role, our Client is based in the United States in the eastern standard timezone, and therefore, you will be working remotely, among a larger client integrated team. We require that our team be willing to work flexible hours to accommodate client requirements in a variety of time zones. We service clients across North America, Europe and Asia/Pacific regions and vary our working hours accordingly.

 big river technologies are committed to employment equity and diversity and welcomes applications from women, visible minorities, aboriginal people, persons with disabilities and persons of any sexual orientation or gender. We are also committed to improving access and opportunities for all individuals, including those with disabilities by identifying and removing barriers that may prevent, inhibit or restrict their access to employment opportunities. If you require accommodation at any stage of our hiring process (application, interviews, assessments, and placement), please contact us via email at hiring@bigrivertech.com. We thank all applicants responding and showing interest to work for us, however; only those interviewed will be contacted.

Title: Organizational Change Management (OCM) Analyst, Data in Action
Desc:
Help us boldly shape retail in Canada
Canadian Tire Corporation, Limited (“CTC”) is one of Canada’s most admired and trusted companies. With world-class Owned Brands and exciting market-leading merchandising strategies, we are continually innovating with purpose: to be there for Canadians from coast-to-coast. We are relentlessly focused on innovating at every level of our business, investing in new technologies and products, and doubling down on the best talent to drive the company forward. It is an especially exciting time to join Canadian Tire and its group of companies.
Competing in the age of analytics and AI will require a new operating architecture - one that is horizontally connected and designed to leverage an integrated foundation of data to drive rapid deployment of insights and intelligent applications. The DNA (Data in Action) program is a collaborative effort to build and mature enterprise capabilities in data governance, business Intelligence, advanced analytics, and artificial intelligence. It also aims to advance the infrastructure and processes that will enable the enterprise to drive more data and insights into action.
Reporting to the Manager, Learning and Communications, the Organizational Change Management (OCM) Analyst, Data in Action will be responsible for planning, designing, and creating marketing materials to support a large enterprise transformation program in the data, analytics and AI domain. They will elucidate and translate technical requirements and create content to communicate technical designs to an executive and enterprise-wide audience. They will maintain active engagement between the DNA program, business stakeholders and HR Corporate Communications throughout the lifecycle of the projects. They will work closely with domain experts to understand processes, create communication plans, and develop content to support engaging and clear communication. They will help ensure written communication in various forms (presentations, blog posts, website etc.) are error-free, relevant, and matches our brand voice and tone. They will contribute to achieving the team’s stakeholder engagement goals and provide support with any other stakeholder engagement materials or activities required for the program’s overall success.
To help define where and how we work, CTC has introduced Hybrid Workplace Personas. While each role fits into a different persona category, this may evolve as employees progress in their career or business needs change. The OCM Analyst is, categorized as a Connector, which means that the incumbent will be working with a variety of colleagues and partners to achieve business outcomes that require a mixed use of virtual and CTC campus presence.
What you’ll do
Gather, understand, and translate business and technical requirements in the data and analytics domain to identify and execute change communication needs
Translate technical designs into content for the broader audience (enterprise and executive)
Balance multiple priorities, prioritize, and deliver high-quality written communications on time in a fast-paced, deadline-oriented environment
Create fresh, clear, engaging, user-focused marketing copy that demystifies complex functionality and generates engagement
Design and produce innovative messaging and visual internal communication to increase program awareness and engagement in various mediums (slides, blog posts, digital brochures, newsletters, website content, executive updates etc.)
Plan and organize meetings, presentations, and other events to engage and inform stakeholders. Facilitate sessions and collaborate with key resources to develop and execute change and communication related deliverables.
Support designing an evaluation plan that monitors adoption and engagement rates of stakeholders
Develop a workplan, identifying key deliverables, effort and duration of tasks and timelines
Conduct regular communication with stakeholders to present deliverables, provide status updates, resolve issues and review updated plan
Support managing a group mailbox and a group page to ensure communication from the program matches our brand voice and tone
Advocate for new ways of working and champion upskilling enterprise wide
What you bring
BA degree in English, Journalism, Communication, Creative Writing, or relevant writing-heavy program
Minimum of three (3) years’ experience in planning, designing, and writing a variety of program marketing materials for a broad enterprise audience, preferably in corporate, internal or employee communications
Demonstrated professional-level writing ability with respect to voice, style, organization, and structure, and clear understanding of the target audience(s) and presentation of key message(s). A portfolio of samples is required
Experience with organizational change management on strategic initiatives, preferably in a corporate, or retail environment
Experience in a fast-paced and unpredictable environment; highly self-directed and able to work well under tight timelines
Advanced competencies in collaboration, communication, team building, and stakeholder engagement
Proficiency with Microsoft Office suite is required (Word, SharePoint & PowerPoint. Visio is an asset)
OCM, proofreading and/or editing certifications would be an asset
About Canadian Tire Corporation
As one of the most trusted brands in Canada, our employees take pride in the work we do across the country. It’s more than the iconic triangle that keeps our employees around. From benefits and perks, to learning and development opportunities, to our commitment to Jumpstart – these are some of the many reasons why Canadian Tire Corporation is one of Canada’s Best Managed Companies . Title: CA - Business Analyst - Mississauga - VitalAire
Desc:
CONTRACT TYPE
Fixed term
PUBLICATION DATE
2022-04-05
COUNTRY
Canada
Company presentation

VitalAire Canada is the Canadian home healthcare subsidiary of Air Liquide, the world leader in gases, medical technologies and services for Industry and Healthcare. VitalAire empowers patients who have sleep apnea or require home oxygen therapy through ongoing respiratory support and compliance.
Here’s what you will do

VitalAire is currently looking for a full-time, permanent Financial Analyst to join our Mississauga, ON office.

As a Financial Analyst you will be responsible for working with large data sets from multiple systems to build standardized reporting packages, create financial models and perform various analyses that will influence business decisions across the company.

Work closely with the Senior Leadership Team and Business Unit managers to deliver financial analysis and reports used in the submission of business cases that align with established KPI goals.
Prepare financial packages and executive presentations for various internal Stakeholders.
Assist in the development of a monthly rolling forecast to improve the quarterly reforecast process and monthly financial results, while investigating gaps and providing explanations.
Examine cost variances and risks to the budget plan, while making efficiency recommendations.
Collaborate with team members to review current results and forecast to identify gaps and risks to the budget plan and integrate inputs from across the organization and assist in preparing the submission.
Work with Business Unit managers to develop detailed budgets that meet the target goals established by the Director.
Take ownership for financial reporting of assigned efficiency projects. This includes building project plans and timelines, and ensuring all departments are integrated into the process.
Support the Operations Controller, as directed, with the Flash package for the Senior Leadership Team review. This may include building cost health view for quarter over quarter comparison, performing price/volume variance on revenues and volume/cost analysis on costs.

Here’s what you will need

A Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting, Business Administration, or another related field
Proficiency in Microsoft Office applications, accounting software and Google Suite
An excellent understanding of budgeting, forecasting and IFRS
Minimum of 2 - 3 years in a similar role / project management experience is desired
Possession of a CPA designation, project management experience, or an MBA would be considered an asset
Experience with Microsoft Power BI is an asset.
Agreeing to disclose your COVID-19 vaccination status, as a condition of employment.
Agreeing to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 and to maintain such fully vaccinated status, as a condition of employment.

Here’s why you should join

Competitive salary, plus bonus and vacation
Competitive benefit flex package & pension plan
Standard working hours for better work/life balance
Tuition reimbursement & career development programs

Additional information

At Air Liquide, we value the health and safety of our customers, patients, and employees. As such, we strongly encourage everyone to get vaccinated against COVID-19. All future employees will be required to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 and to maintain such fully vaccinated status.

VitalAire Canada Inc. provides equal opportunities for all applicants and is committed to fostering an inclusive and accessible environment. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. We thank all applicants for their interest; however only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

Title: Data Protection Analyst - 336602
Desc:
Data Protection Analyst
On behalf of our client in the Banking Sector, PROCOM is looking for a Data Protection Analyst.
Data Protection Analyst – Job Description
As a Data Protection Analyst in the Capital Markets Application Access Control Group (AACG), you will enhance, implement, monitor and support data loss protection controls and processes within Capital Markets
Implement data protection rules to monitor, alert and block suspicious activity
Analyze reporting to identify and follow up on suspicious activities and opportunities for exemptions
Onboard users to bank’s preferred data protection solutions
Manage the clean-up of legacy access exemptions, including monitoring and reporting monthly metrics to track project progress
Identify process improvement/reengineering opportunities through streamlining, simplification, elimination of redundancies, automation, standardization, etc.
Create and maintain reporting related to the monitoring of key data loss and cyber risk initiatives
Assist with implementing improvements to reporting dashboards that monitor and highlight data loss/cyber risk areas
Work with businesses across Capital Markets and collaborate with business partners across the Enterprise to support data loss and cyber risk initiatives
Work with functional groups across the organization (i.e., internet security, data protection team, compliance, operational risk, supplier management office, etc.) to create, document, and maintain operational processes; provide guidance, assistance and support
Act as the primary support contact for Capital Markets related cyber risk and data loss inquiries
Constantly seek to improve own capacity, skills and expertise and communicate regularly with management and other relevant parties to keep impacted resources informed

Data Protection Analyst – Mandatory Skills
A good understanding of data risk and exposures
Hybrid BA/Data Analyst role
Strong Data skills
Ability to multi-task, prioritize and work independently under tight deadlines in a fast-paced environment
Ability to remain persistent and pursue evidence during investigations to reach a resolution
Strong interpersonal, verbal and written communication skills, with an ability to work effectively with all levels of staff and management
Strong analytical, trend analysis, problem identification and resolution skills
Fully proficient with MS Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook)

Data Protection Analyst – Nice to Have Skills
Experience in creating and implementing reporting and processes
Experience with identifying and implementing process/system changes which reduce risk, increase efficiencies or enrich customer service
Experience working in data loss/cyber risk/cyber security

Data Protection Analyst - Assignment Start Date
ASAP – 12 months to start
Data Protection Analyst - Assignment Location
Toronto, ON – Work Hybrid

Title: Pricing & Promotions Analyst
Desc:
What Is the Prescription For A Great Career?
At Rexall, we are community difference makers. Our hearts skip a beat when we meet talent who sees the bigger picture and wants to make an impact in our communities, our teams, and our business. This means finding even better ways to work, share ideas, and making a material difference in the Rexall journey.
We are leaders in health and wellness and a talent destination for over 7000+ Rexall team members. We are proud to be part of the McKesson family, ranked eighth in the fortune 500. Together, we are defining better health through innovation, service, and living the “ICARE” values. Talk about a dream team!
At Rexall, we are better together. We serve our customers, partners, and patients best—we are our best—when everyone brings their true self to work. Our connected, inclusive culture celebrates our lived experiences, backgrounds, expertise, and self-expression to let us win as one team. Leveraging our differences distinguishes us and brings out our best performance.
The road ahead is one of adventure and heart. Are you our next all star?
The Role: Pricing & Promotions Analyst
Reporting to the Manager, Pricing and Promotions, this role will be an integral member of a high-profile, cross functional-strategic initiative focused on optimizing the effectiveness of Rexall’s promotional activities. The Pricing & Promotions Analyst acts as consultants to key Category Management partners, providing fact-based insights and recommendations to improve total sales, margin and overall promotions' effectiveness.
Principal Responsibilities:
Will be responsible for accurately forecasting, tracking, and reporting the sales, margin, and promotional impact and effectiveness across a range of front of store categories (Cosmetics, Convenience, Beauty and Health etc).
Work directly with Category Managers and Directors to optimize promotional sales and make recommendations based on trends, targets, promotional strategies
Provide proactive recommendations on sales-, margin-, and basket-driving promotions
Monitors and analyzes promotional activities to determine efficiency, accuracy, and performance relative to forecast and identify trends
Analyze data to calculate baseline sales and margin and estimate incremental sales and margin for promotional within a set of categories.
Own real-time consolidated forecast; measure and provide reporting relative to category targets and other metrics
Support the Manager, Pricing and Promotions to develop and implement product price strategies including segment strategies for the various markets and channels.
Download and organize baseline price information, analyze and report on inconsistencies, and finds opportunities to optimize sales and profitability through pricing strategies.
Build various reports such as daily trend report, ad reports, period end reports, etc. for various customers in Merchandising.
Perform weekly updates to Ad Reporting Tool and develop promo reports on ad hoc basis.
Update monthly scorecard with new data and present results to team to show performance year over year.
Perform other duties as assigned to support Rexall Pharmacy Group ULC
Knowledge, Skills and Experience:
2-3 year College Diploma in a related field.
Analytical and strong attention to detail: including; exploring data, discovering patterns, relationships, anomalies and trends.
Excellent organizational, time management and multi-tasking skills.
Customer-focused and a great teammate.
Excellent communication skills both written and verbal.
Solid understanding of Microsoft Office software, specifically Excel. Access is preferred.
The Rexall DNA:
Ready to make an impact- You are mission-driven and want to make a difference
Builds consensus- Your people-first mindset shows in all that you do
Embraces change- You move fast and change excites you
Drives achievement- You are wired to always exceed your personal best
Overcomes adversity- You see the world as glass half full and embrace a good challenge
Trail blazer- You love creating the path forward and being able to shape the future
Fun- You think laughter is the best medicine and your positive energy is contagious
Side effects may include…
A closely connected culture
Competitive compensation, pension, benefits, personal days, employee discounts, and vacation time
Fully utilizing your talent
Professional growth and development via challenging projects and assignments
Warm and fuzzy feelings knowing you have helped your community, your team, the business and social causes through the Rexall Care Network
The Hiring Process:
Start your #ALLin journey by applying the role you want online
We’ll send you an invitation to complete a digital interview so you can tell us more about yourself
One of the members of our Talent Attraction team will connect with you to chat about our #ALLin, award winning and Great Place to Work certified culture
Follow us on @LifeatRexall on IG and Rexall Pharmacy Group on LinkedIn
Bonus! You can earn some cash – for every single friend you refer once you get hired!
Are you? #ALLin?
It’s a condition of employment that you be fully vaccinated within 14 days of your start date, and should you receive an offer you will have to attest to this in writing. In addition, you may be required to upload proof of vaccination or have a valid medical or other Human Rights Code-related exemption.
Rexall Pharmacy Group ULC is committed to providing an accessible environment for all of our customers, employees, and job applicants. Rexall Pharmacy Group ULC will make available to any selected applicants’ accommodations and/or accessible formats should they require. Candidates are encouraged to discuss any accommodation they may need in order to allow for the most effective selection process.

Title: Senior Business Analyst
Desc:
From coast-to-coast, our inspiring colleagues are at the heart of what we do best: helping people, businesses and society prosper in good times and be resilient in bad times. With our team, you’ll bring this purpose to life every day by living our Values, being open to change, and pursuing your goals.
At Intact, we’ll give you countless opportunities to learn and grow, alongside a diverse and passionate community of experts – the best the industry has to offer. You’ll be empowered to be your best self, do your best work, and make a meaningful impact. Here, you can: shape the future of insurance, win as a team, and grow with us.


About the role


As a Senior Business Analyst, you will have a big impact on driving change for the West division for the Distribution team. You will tie your strong data analysis skills to Intact’s business strategies, goals and objectives. You will work closely with the Senior Vice President, VPs and Directors in the West in presenting the data in a succinct, easy to understand method while collaborating regularly in providing guidance and recommended solutions to the business leaders.
This position is a permanent opportunity, reporting to a Vice President and is based in the West.

This role will offer you the chance to:
Supports distribution’s initiatives by data modelling, data analytics, forecasting, ad hoc reporting and identifying trends and business opportunities to pursue
Ability to think strategically, provide recommendation, strategic guidance and facilitate innovative solutions - effectively communicate recommendations based on data analysis and forecasting
Create visual models and engaging presentations using Powerpoint and MS Office programs
Project management skills –be proactive, manage competing deadlines, collaborate and involve various stakeholders, when necessary, facilitate and coordinate meetings
Create and manage a consolidated broker relationship database
Analyze Data and identify opportunities at the broker level both for Profitability and Growth
Ability to develop the regions yearly plan
Provide timely, professional ad hoc data and reports as needed


Qualifications


What you bring to the table:
A rigorous and meticulous analyst, passionate about data.
Engaged, accountable, a good team player with a strong sense of urgency
Flexible, adaptable, open, fast learner and curious.
Comfortable working in complex environments and multidisciplinary teams
Minimum of 2 years of Underwriting experience (Commercial Lines and Personal Lines experience preferred)
1 year of actuary experience strongly preferred and/or completed or working towards ACAS or FCAS exams
Experience in building the organization’s plans or budgets
Advanced level use of Microsoft products – PowerPoint, Excel (complex functions and macros), & Access, Other programs include: Power BI and Tableau, python, SAS, R
University Degree in Mathematics, Actuarial, Finance or Economics
Here are a few reasons why others have joined our team:
An award-winning, inspiring workplace that supports its people and recognizes great work
Stimulating, challenging projects and development opportunities to help you grow your skills and career
A comprehensive financial rewards program that recognizes your success
An extensive, flexible benefits package
An industry leading Employee Share Purchase Plan where we match 50% of net shares purchased
A $350 annual wellness account that promotes an active lifestyle
Flexible Work Arrangements
We’re proud to support a flexible hybrid approach which gives everyone the best of both worlds. While there are no minimum or maximum time requirements, each team’s need for in-person connections will be different and there will be times you’ll join your colleagues at the office.


Closing Statement


We are an Equal Opportunity Employer
If we can provide a specific adjustment to make the recruitment process more accessible for you, please let us know when we reach out about a job opportunity. We’ll work with you to meet your needs.
Click here to review other important information about the hiring process, including background checks, internal candidates, and eligibility to work in Canada.
This posting closes on April 24, 2022 at 11:59PM EST.

Title: Vendor Management Analyst
Desc:

Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.
The role:
Responsible for contract management activities for contingent labour, administer hire/renewal requests within the various systems (Fieldglass, Ariba, Coupa), review financials/funding/invoicing, and evaluate statement of work engagements.

Research and evaluate requirements of suppliers based on price, quality, selection, service, support, availability and other relevant factors.Review bids from suppliers for conformity to contract requirements and determines acceptable bids.Provides bids, process specifications, test and progress reports, and other exhibits as necessary.Requests or approves amendments to or extensions of contracts.Advises relevant departments of contractual rights and obligations.Monitor contract assignments for upcoming renewal dates, spend, and invoicing errors.Monitor valid contracts within a given period, extract time reports from PPM Clarity system, match time reports to contract based on the Investment Names and SID.Provide Vendor with time reporting data if required.Validate invoices have accurate information from the vendor - resource, contract, time period, funding sourceProvides Project and Hiring Managers with status and issue.Monitor and track approvals through contract and invoice payment to ensure timely turnaround.Manage database for tracking invoices and link to FIS, PPM and FieldglassData Analysis - extract data from multiple sources for validation and tracking

Review contract deviations - actual verses cost (invoice) and track against accrualsWork with FIS Support to correct error reporting - missing contract / COBContract closuresMonitor Smartstream for contract accuracyMonthly Missing invoice tracker (Monthly)Monthly Milestone confirmation (Monthly)Inbox managementTech M aged outstanding Invoice report (Weekly)Follow up with HM for outstanding Issues (3 times a week)Follow up with TechM for outstanding issues (Weekly)Follow up with Alt vendors for outstanding issues (Weekly)Paid updates (Wednesday/Friday)PPM Discrepancy report (Weekly)Ad-hoc ReportingHM Payment/ Outstanding Invoice InquiriesPool funded invoice submission (Daily)Database update (Weekly)Invoice Stamp Update (Daily)ResEdge/Fieldglass database update (Daily)Design and implement new functionality in Resedge, CMS template and Tracking Log to fit the needs of the businessAnalyse, update and improve internal knowledgebase guides and help BTO team solve recurring issues by documenting and promoting best current practicesConduct meetings to resolve conflicts and queries raised by HM,PCOs & PMs and ensure that business owns that and is prepared to use the solutions providedMonitored document flow from initiation to execution and, as appropriate, initiated and escalated actions to publish the contractsProcess and manage sub-agreements, change orders and sometimes billings. Work with TPMP, TPRM, IT&S Contract, eConsent, QAM and other teams for the aggregation of technical, legal and risk management requirements throughout the entire contracting processPrepare special reports and analysis as requiredAct as first level of escalation for issues related to contracts.

3) Financial management (3+ years experience with cost allocation, invoicing, funding management)
4) Understanding of resource management, workforce management, and/or contingent labour
5) Database and Query knowledge
Nice-To-Have Skills:
1) FI/Banking Industry experience
What's in it for you?
We provide an excellent opportunity to lead initiatives with risk and IT professionals across Scotiabank’s global footprint to Keep the Bank Safe and Amplify results.
We are technology partners who help the business transform how our employees around the world work.
We have an inclusive and collaborative working environment that encourages creativity, curiosity, and celebrates success!
You'll get to work with and learn from diverse industry leaders, who have hailed from top technology companies around the world.
We foster an environment of innovation and continuous learning.
We care about our people, allowing them to design how they work to deliver amazing results.
We offer a competitive total rewards package, including a performance bonus, company matching programs (pension & Employee Share Ownership), generous vacation; health/medical/wellness benefits; employee banking privileges.
Location(s): Canada : Ontario : Toronto

Scotiabank is a leading bank in the Americas. Guided by our purpose: "for every future", we help our customers, their families and their communities achieve success through a broad range of advice, products and services, including personal and commercial banking, wealth management and private banking, corporate and investment banking, and capital markets.

At Scotiabank, we value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the Bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. If you require accommodation (including, but not limited to, an accessible interview site, alternate format documents, ASL Interpreter, or Assistive Technology) during the recruitment and selection process, please let our Recruitment team know. Candidates must apply directly online to be considered for this role. We thank all applicants for their interest in a career at Scotiabank; however, only those candidates who are selected for an interview will be contacted.

Title: Senior Business Analyst (BA)
Desc:
Senior Business Analyst
Become a primary liaison between our clients, our product engineering team, and the operations team in a high-growth technology firm based in Saint John, N.B. Lead the company's requirement definition & process documentation processes.

Focus Areas
Defining & Documenting Requirements: Equip the product engineering team with the specifications required to build exactly what the customer is looking for.
Be proficient at extracting, understanding, and articulating clients' requirements in a way that's easy for the product engineering team to act upon;
Work with the product engineering team to define what is required from the clients. Provide these requirements to the clients in a digestible format, then validate the response(s);
Work with clients to discover potential improvements to our products (new features, bug mitigation, etc.).
Defining & Documenting Processes: Lead the initiative toward having all internal and client-facing processes properly defined, documented, and organized.
Lead the creation of documentation for current and future state internal processes;
Identify potential gaps in our existing processes and provide solutions where applicable;
Identify potential gaps in our existing documentation and provide solutions where applicable;
Define configuration specifications and business analysis requirements;
Define and manage test cases for new products and changes to existing products;
Prepare integration plans for product deployments.


Qualifications
5+ years of experience in related positions.
Willingness & ability to work with clients, including traveling to their offices as needed. Travel expenses would be covered by Four Eyes.
Degree or diploma in Business, Computer Science, Engineering or a related field of study.
Highly technical & analytical, experienced with implementing complex software solutions.
Quantitative skills; ability to use hard data and metrics to back up assumptions and develop thoughtful & actionable business cases.
Demonstrated ability to perform with significant responsibility in a dynamic environment where decisions are made rapidly.
Experience working with Data-driven Applications in a Cloud environment.
Experience working with clients and developers to define, scope and prioritize product requirements.
Ability to lead junior analysts and support them with their deliverables
Four Eyes Financial is a Regulatory Technology (RegTech) company based in Saint John, NB. We are at the forefront of change in how Wealth firms think about their data and their compliance functions. Our proprietary Intelligent Compliance Platform, with multiple compliance solutions, streamlines interactions between Advisors, Clients, and Head Office.
We have a diverse team of bright and high-performing people and we are in growth mode. You'd fit in well if you thrive in a fast-paced environment, have a thirst for learning, enjoy improving systems and processes, and focus on excellence in everything you do.
Some of our great benefits include:
Health & Dental Benefits
RRSP matching program
Competitive salary
Generous vacation days
Hybrid work options
And more!
Are you ready to accelerate your career? If you have a pioneering spirit, a passion for results, seek meaningful work and want to make an impact on a changing industry, come join us!

Title: Analyst
Desc:
Your Opportunity:
Exciting opportunity with Activity & Workload Consulting & Analytics. The Activity & Workload team is a service of People, Health Professions and Information Technology that: Provides education and resources to support operational leaders & front-line staff to accurately measure activity and workload. Works collaboratively with health care providers, leaders, and other stakeholders like IT, Finance, and Analytics to understand and leverage activity and workload data. Provide a quality assurance program to ensure the accuracy of activity and workload data. Provides leadership and support regarding activity and workload data analytics to ensure that activity and workload measurement and reporting provides value for clinical operations and the system as whole. Provides activity and workload data for external regulatory reporting to Alberta Health and the Canadian Institute for Health Information, and internal reporting such as Operational Best Practice (OBP).
Description:
As an Activity and Workload Analyst you will be working closely with patient care directors, managers, front-line staff, and other members of the Activity & Workload team to implement activity and workload collection methodologies across AHS’ operational areas including ambulatory care, nursing, diagnostic and therapeutic services. This role works collaboratively with stakeholders to develop activity and workload capture methodologies, while meeting national and provincial standards; develop and initiate review cycles for associated workload methodologies and standardized workload times; validate workflow for activity and workload data capture; resolve activity and workload data issues; and to develop educational tools and associated training to best meet the needs of the clinical areas.
Classification: Analyst
Union: Exempt

Negotiable Location: Provincial

Maximum Salary: $49.11

Post-secondary degree or diploma in an Allied Health Profession or nursing. The successful candidate will have five years recent clinical experience.
Additional Required Qualifications:
The successful candidate will have excellent interpersonal, communication and organizational skills, excellent consensus building, guiding/education and diplomacy skills.
Preferred Qualifications:
Advanced degree, diploma or training in health leadership, clinical informatics or health information management preferred. Management and or instructor experience is an asset. Experience defining, implementing and supporting workload measurement and strong analytical and problem solving skills also an asset. Commitment to meet deadlines and produce high quality deliverables and the ability to provide leadership and work as a team desired.

Title: BI Data Scientist
Desc:
About Fusemachines
Fusemachines is a leading AI strategy, talent, and education services provider. Founded by Sameer Maskey Ph.D., Adjunct Associate Professor at Columbia University, Fusemachines has a core mission of democratizing AI. With a presence in 4 countries (Nepal, the United States, Canada, and the Dominican Republic and more than 250 full-time employees) Fusemachines seeks to bring its global expertise in AI to transform companies around the world.
About the role:
We are looking for a BI Data Scientist who has experience in online gambling and can write codes and is interested in taking over tasks from the Data Science Team. Amongst others, you build a self-service analytics solution and support various stakeholders' needs by providing insights in various formats (reports, dashboards, and analysis). Being a field expert, the BI Data Scientist needs to understand business challenges and the data maturity of the clients to build the most adapted solution including using Machine learning.
This is a part-time consulting role and it could over time become a full-time consulting position.
Role scope:
You deliver business intelligence solutions and provide thought leadership and technical consultation to the various stakeholders that the team supports
You occasionally design and develop the ETL processes for the proposed data model and utilize them efficiently
You support the business with ad-hoc reporting requests and perform analysis
You model and improve algorithms given a set of business cases and help implement them in production
You are able to build and interpret probabilistic models of complex, high-dimensional systems
You perform complex ad-hoc data analysis and communicate data stories when required
You evaluate model output, formulate and test hypotheses, weigh alternatives, and determine appropriate responses
You demonstrate proficiency in one or more areas of the following areas:
statistics, machine learning, deep learning, decision trees, clustering, network analysis, graph theory, regression analysis, topological data analysis
Qualifications
Which skills should you bring to the pitch:
University Degree. in a scientific discipline such as mathematics, data science, IT or physics. Ideally, you also hold a master’s degree.
Proficiency. Minimum 2 years of experience in Business Intelligence or data analytics. Preferably 3+ years of work experience.
Programming Skills. You are an experienced user of Python and gained experience in Machine Learning.
Tools. Proficient with dashboarding tools such as QlikSense, Domo, Tableau, or other enterprise tools.
Technical background. Solid technical background with a complete understanding of database design and modelling using Redshift, MySQL, SQL Server, or other relational databases.
Analytical Thinker. Passion for analytics and strong analytical abilities.
Teamwork. Experience in working closely with a data team or an analytics team.
Who we’re looking for:
Agile Mindset. This is about learning and adapting, continuously improving what we do to deliver a valuable product to our customers. You collaborate and communicate leading to team success

Responsible for contract management activities for contingent labour, administer hire/renewal requests within the various systems (Fieldglass, Ariba, Coupa), review financials/funding/invoicing, and evaluate statement of work engagements.
Is this role right for you?
Research and evaluate requirements of suppliers based on price, quality, selection, service, support, availability and other relevant factors.Review bids from suppliers for conformity to contract requirements and determines acceptable bids.Provides bids, process specifications, test and progress reports, and other exhibits as necessary.Requests or approves amendments to or extensions of contracts.Advises relevant departments of contractual rights and obligations.Monitor contract assignments for upcoming renewal dates, spend, and invoicing errors.Monitor valid contracts within a given period, extract time reports from PPM Clarity system, match time reports to contract based on the Investment Names and SID.Provide Vendor with time reporting data if required.Validate invoices have accurate information from the vendor - resource, contract, time period, funding sourceProvides Project and Hiring Managers with status and issue.Monitor and track approvals through contract and invoice payment to ensure timely turnaround.Manage database for tracking invoices and link to FIS, PPM and FieldglassData Analysis - extract data from multiple sources for validation and tracking

Review contract deviations - actual verses cost (invoice) and track against accrualsWork with FIS Support to correct error reporting - missing contract / COBContract closuresMonitor Smartstream for contract accuracyMonthly Missing invoice tracker (Monthly)Monthly Milestone confirmation (Monthly)Inbox managementTech M aged outstanding Invoice report (Weekly)Follow up with HM for outstanding Issues (3 times a week)Follow up with TechM for outstanding issues (Weekly)Follow up with Alt vendors for outstanding issues (Weekly)Paid updates (Wednesday/Friday)PPM Discrepancy report (Weekly)Ad-hoc ReportingHM Payment/ Outstanding Invoice InquiriesPool funded invoice submission (Daily)Database update (Weekly)Invoice Stamp Update (Daily)ResEdge/Fieldglass database update (Daily)Design and implement new functionality in Resedge, CMS template and Tracking Log to fit the needs of the businessAnalyse, update and improve internal knowledgebase guides and help BTO team solve recurring issues by documenting and promoting best current practicesConduct meetings to resolve conflicts and queries raised by HM,PCOs & PMs and ensure that business owns that and is prepared to use the solutions providedMonitored document flow from initiation to execution and, as appropriate, initiated and escalated actions to publish the contractsProcess and manage sub-agreements, change orders and sometimes billings. Work with TPMP, TPRM, IT&S Contract, eConsent, QAM and other teams for the aggregation of technical, legal and risk management requirements throughout the entire contracting processPrepare special reports and analysis as requiredAct as first level of escalation for issues related to contracts.

Nice-To-Have Skills:
1) FI/Banking Industry experience
What's in it for you?
We provide an excellent opportunity to lead initiatives with risk and IT professionals across Scotiabank’s global footprint to Keep the Bank Safe and Amplify results.
We are technology partners who help the business transform how our employees around the world work.

Title: Senior Business Analyst (BA)
Desc:
Senior Business Analyst
Become a primary liaison between our clients, our product engineering team, and the operations team in a high-growth technology firm based in Saint John, N.B. Lead the company's requirement definition & process documentation processes.

Focus Areas
Defining & Documenting Requirements: Equip the product engineering team with the specifications required to build exactly what the customer is looking for.
Be proficient at extracting, understanding, and articulating clients' requirements in a way that's easy for the product engineering team to act upon;
Work with the product engineering team to define what is required from the clients. Provide these requirements to the clients in a digestible format, then validate the response(s);
Work with clients to discover potential improvements to our products (new features, bug mitigation, etc.).
Defining & Documenting Processes: Lead the initiative toward having all internal and client-facing processes properly defined, documented, and organized.
Lead the creation of documentation for current and future state internal processes;
Identify potential gaps in our existing processes and provide solutions where applicable;
Identify potential gaps in our existing documentation and provide solutions where applicable;
Define configuration specifications and business analysis requirements;
Define and manage test cases for new products and changes to existing products;
Prepare integration plans for product deployments.


Qualifications
5+ years of experience in related positions.
Willingness & ability to work with clients, including traveling to their offices as needed. Travel expenses would be covered by Four Eyes.
Degree or diploma in Business, Computer Science, Engineering or a related field of study.
Highly technical & analytical, experienced with implementing complex software solutions.
Quantitative skills; ability to use hard data and metrics to back up assumptions and develop thoughtful & actionable business cases.
Demonstrated ability to perform with significant responsibility in a dynamic environment where decisions are made rapidly.
Experience working with Data-driven Applications in a Cloud environment.
Experience working with clients and developers to define, scope and prioritize product requirements.
Ability to lead junior analysts and support them with their deliverables
Four Eyes Financial is a Regulatory Technology (RegTech) company based in Saint John, NB. We are at the forefront of change in how Wealth firms think about their data and their compliance functions. Our proprietary Intelligent Compliance Platform, with multiple compliance solutions, streamlines interactions between Advisors, Clients, and Head Office.
We have a diverse team of bright and high-performing people and we are in growth mode. You'd fit in well if you thrive in a fast-paced environment, have a thirst for learning, enjoy improving systems and processes, and focus on excellence in everything you do.
Some of our great benefits include:
Health & Dental Benefits
RRSP matching program
Competitive salary
Generous vacation days
Hybrid work options
And more!
Are you ready to accelerate your career? If you have a pioneering spirit, a passion for results, seek meaningful work and want to make an impact on a changing industry, come join us!

Title: Analyst
Desc:
Your Opportunity:
Exciting opportunity with Activity & Workload Consulting & Analytics. The Activity & Workload team is a service of People, Health Professions and Information Technology that: Provides education and resources to support operational leaders & front-line staff to accurately measure activity and workload. Works collaboratively with health care providers, leaders, and other stakeholders like IT, Finance, and Analytics to understand and leverage activity and workload data. Provide a quality assurance program to ensure the accuracy of activity and workload data. Provides leadership and support regarding activity and workload data analytics to ensure that activity and workload measurement and reporting provides value for clinical operations and the system as whole. Provides activity and workload data for external regulatory reporting to Alberta Health and the Canadian Institute for Health Information, and internal reporting such as Operational Best Practice (OBP).
Description:
As an Activity and Workload Analyst you will be working closely with patient care directors, managers, front-line staff, and other members of the Activity & Workload team to implement activity and workload collection methodologies across AHS’ operational areas including ambulatory care, nursing, diagnostic and therapeutic services. This role works collaboratively with stakeholders to develop activity and workload capture methodologies, while meeting national and provincial standards; develop and initiate review cycles for associated workload methodologies and standardized workload times; validate workflow for activity and workload data capture; resolve activity and workload data issues; and to develop educational tools and associated training to best meet the needs of the clinical areas.
Classification: Analyst
Union: Exempt
Department: Connect Care Activity & Worklo
Primary Location: Southport Tower
Negotiable Location: Provincial

Shifts per cycle: 20

Days Off: Saturday/Sunday

Maximum Salary: $49.11
