Title: Senior Business Analyst
Desc:
Job Description

As a Senior Business Analyst (Sr. BA), within Technology & Operations - Canada IT, you will work side-by-side with business organizations and key customers in Canada. The successful candidate will help to identify new product opportunities and understand new features and capabilities planned for existing products and services. You will provide a critical communication channel between the Canada Corporate Marketing and Innovation Team and multiple Digital Business Team Lines of Business. You will need to be familiar with the various Digital Products, Services and Digital Experiences to ensure that Canada is accurately represented in Product Roadmaps, OKRs, PI Planning and WSJF scoring.

Major duties / responsibilities:

Development of business process models, business requirements/user stories (functional and non-functional) and product backlogs.

Increased knowledge of company issues and data challenges of the business.

Serves as the requirement's liaison between the business community and the Digital Business Teams.

Interpret business requirements to articulate the business needs to be addressed.

Strong analysis skills are required to help breakdown problems/challenges into logical steps.

Effective at collaborating with cross-functional & global operations customers to gain consensus and drive support for new insights, products, and process.

Coordinate the efforts of internal and external customers and technical teams during the development and implementation of applications and processes.

Proactively identify user requirements, and application issues & solutions, which optimize the ability to achieve business objectives.

Prepare UAT test cases and actively participates in the testing phase of projects.

Additional Job Description

Requirements:

Post Secondary Education required, Computer Science Degree preferred

10+ years in an applicable business environment.

Proven understanding of Business Process fundamentals; including requirements elicitation, customer collaboration & communications, and problem-solving skills

Experience in IT project management including IT strategy and roadmap development.

Expertise in applying requirements tools

Experience with Dealer/Customer Business Processes

Experience with Agile development methodologies

Able to write and managed Business Requirements Documents, Epics, Features and User Stories

Understand Business Process Modeling

Knowledge in functional areas and business process domains.

Demonstrates critical skills such as collaboration, strong written and verbal communication skills, and analytical capability

Independently facilitate meetings.

Prioritize, manage multiple contending priorities, in a fast-paced environment

Successful candidates will be required to attest to, and be prepared to provide proof of, their vaccination status and that any job offer will be conditional on the candidate being fully vaccinated.

This role offers a Hybrid Work Appropriately strategy:


This position does not require an employee to be onsite full-time to perform most effectively. The employee's role enables them to work at a GM facility or off-site as frequently as needed or desired.

About GM

Our vision is a world with Zero Crashes, Zero Emissions and Zero Congestion and we embrace the responsibility to lead the change that will make our world better, safer and more equitable for all.

Why Join Us

We aspire to be the most inclusive company in the world. We believe we all must make a choice every day - individually and collectively - to drive meaningful change through our words, our deeds and our culture. Our Work Appropriately philosophy supports our foundation of inclusion and provides employees the flexibility to work where they can have the greatest impact on achieving our goals, dependent on role needs. Every day, we want every employee, no matter their background, ethnicity, preferences, or location, to feel they belong to one General Motors team.

Diversity Information

General Motors is committed to being a workplace that is not only free of discrimination, but one that genuinely fosters inclusion and belonging. We strongly believe that workforce diversity creates an environment in which our employees can thrive and develop better products for our customers. We understand and embrace the variety through which people gain experiences whether through professional, personal, educational, or volunteeropportunities.

We encourage interested candidates to review the key responsibilities and qualifications and apply for any positions that match your skills and capabilities.

Equal Employment Opportunity Statement

Accommodation is available for applicants with disabilities. Should you be contacted by General Motors of Canada, please advise if you require accommodation. General Motors of Canada values diversity and is an equal opportunity employer.

Title: Senior Policy Analyst
Desc:
About the Insurance Council
The Insurance Council of British Columbia is the regulatory organization that licenses and regulates the activities of over 38,000 life and general insurance agents, general insurance salespersons, insurance adjusters, and restricted travel insurance agents in British Columbia.
The Opportunity
The primary focus of this role is to assist with the development of guidelines, policies and standards for licensees in conducting their business in accordance with the Financial Institutions Act, Council Rules and Council’s Code of Conduct. In addition, the Senior Policy Analyst will play an important role in identifying gaps and required policies to align with changes in regulation or industry practice.
Why Work for the Insurance Council?
Work with a great team of people in a rewarding career that makes a difference. We’re in a downtown location with plenty of amenities nearby. The Insurance Council has a friendly and collaborative environment with a team who’s committed to protecting the public.

We offer a comprehensive health and dental plan
Work-life balance
This position is mostly remote work enabled. The incumbent would be required to come into the office as needed.
Professional development
Equitable employment opportunities

We have established health and safety practices to limit exposure to COVID-19, including a vaccination requirement for all staff.
Who We’re Looking For
The ideal candidate will have the ability to interpret and apply legislation and policies to differing situations, project management skills with demonstrated analytical and judgement skills.
Duties and Responsibilities

Play a key role in the development of new and updated policies to support practices and regulatory compliance that fosters professionalism, competency and conduct
Research and write guidelines, policies and notices
Review current policies against regulatory requirements to ensure consistency and identify gaps
Provide advice on appropriate controls to support policies and evidence of compliance
Participate in projects where the outcome may impact policies or guidelines
Prepare briefing materials such as briefing notes, presentations and reports
Develop sound data analysis
Maintain excellent and up-to-date knowledge of the the Financial Institutions Act, Council’s Code of Conduct, the Council Rules and other relevant legislation and industry practices
Participate in determining an action plan in response to regulatory or industry change
Undertake horizon scanning to identify upcoming developments within the insurance industry and working with the Manager of Policy to identify next steps
Work with Practice and Quality Assurance team to identify gaps and overlapping work
Work with Professional Conduct team to identify trends in complaints and investigations
Identify emerging industry trends and assist in determining an appropriate course of action
Liaise with other departments as required
Assist management, as required
Handle other duties as assigned


Qualifications

Minimum three years of experience in policy development, project and/or program management, and strategic planning.

Experience in managing multi-stakeholder programs or initiatives.
Experience in managing an inter-disciplinary team.
Experience in writing reports and briefings for senior executive or equivalent.
Experience in conceptualizing, analyzing, investigating and reporting on a wide variety of issues.
Experience in program design and evaluation.
Experience interpreting, applying and advising on federal and provincial programs, government legislation, regulatory requirements and policies.
Skill set in researching, writing, critical thinking and business acumen.
Computer skills, having proficiency with the Microsoft Office suite, specifically with word processing and spreadsheet programs.
Bachelor’s degree in relevant field of study such as economic, political science, law or business administration is an asset.
Experience in the development of legislation and regulations is an asset.
Additional experience in a regulatory or financial services role is an asset.
Insurance experience is an asset.

Title: Sr Analyst Digital Marketing Canada
Desc:
Description
18 month contract
Built on innovation. Powered by an entrepreneurial spirit. Driven by a passion for putting the customer first. These are hallmark characteristics that define our company as well as the associates who fuel our success. Bath & Body Works is one of the world’s leading specialty retailers. We believe in cultivating a values-based community of associates that reflects our customers and where diversity, equity and inclusion are part of how we operate.

Our Digital Marketing team at Bath & Body Works is comprised of highly collaborative associates that are dynamic and take pride in everything they do. We have a strong focus on growth and development and a passion for your success.
Description
The Senior Digital Marketing Analyst, reporting to the Director of Digital Marketing, will join the team for an 18-month mat leave replacement contract, with possible extension. The role primarily focuses on the development and execution of brand paid media strategies including paid search, social and programmatic. In collaboration with an external agency, the Analyst’s objective is to grow Canadian E-commerce and store traffic, ultimately resulting in an increase in revenue through an omni-channel strategic approach.
Roles and Responsibilities
Develop ad content strategy that supports daily promotions, big events and holiday gifting
Execute creative briefs, partnering closely with graphics and translation teams
Provide a weekly performance overview of paid media channels, comparing KPIs to past promotional activity
Manage a testing calendar, collect and analyze data, identify trends and insights to maximize performance
Assist in marketing campaign hindsight process, aggregating cross-channel assets
Act as key liaison between agency and brand
Drive professional growth by staying close to the latest industry trends through continual research, webinars and industry events

Other Responsibilities
Oversee and support one direct report with regular touchbases, periodic performance reviews and coaching
QA site creative deliverables to ensure accurate brand and promotional messaging
Maintain local brick & mortar search listings

Qualifications
Bachelor’s Degree in Marketing or related field
1-3 years of paid media program management for a retail company in-house or at an agency
Experience working in beauty, consumer goods, fashion or retail industries preferred
Ability to extract actionable insights from various data points
Understanding of content and A/B testing strategies
Ability to multitask and project manage key business priorities in a fast-paced environment
Attention to detail with strong written and verbal communication skills required
Strong team player and positive, proactive attitude with great interpersonal skills
Ability to brief senior leaders, foster relationships with internal and external teams, and be solid support for immediate team members
Ability to think innovatively and creatively and change course if necessary, to achieve desired results
Results oriented, must be willing to take ownership of all assigned responsibilities and adhere to deadlines
Highly proficient in English and working French
Proficiency in MS Office (Excel, PowerPoint, and Word)
Knowledge of Adobe Creative Cloud (In Design, Photoshop and Illustrator) is an asset

What you can expect from us:
Hybrid work model
Employee Discount
Benefits: Medical, Dental, Eye Care
Competitive salary
Indoor gym
Free Parking
Fun challenges guaranteed!

An equal opportunity employer, we do not discriminate in hiring or terms and conditions of employment because of an individual’s race, ancestry, colour, place of origin, religion, gender, gender identity, national origin, citizenship, age, disability, sexual orientation, pregnancy, genetic information, family status or marital status, or any other protected category recognized by provincial or federal laws. We only hires individuals authorized for employment in Canada.

Title: ADMN O 21R - Business Analyst - CLOSING DATE EXTENDED
Desc:
Amendment (April 08) - Posting closing date extended to April 18
Business Analyst
Administrative Officer R21

There is currently a temporary opportunity available until 10/31/2022, this temporary opportunity may be extended or may become permanent.
An eligibility list for future permanent and/or temporary vacancies may be established.

On November 1, 2021 the BC Public Service announced the COVID-19 Vaccination Policy that defines the conditions and expectations for BC Public Service employees regarding vaccination against COVID-19. Among other possible measures, proof of vaccination will be required. It is a term of acceptance of employment that you agree to comply with all vaccination requirements that apply to the public service. More information can be found here.

A great opportunity to take the next step in your career

The Consumer Taxation Programs Branch (CTPB) is mandated with the development and delivery of effective, efficient and equitable administrative and compliance programs under the Provincial Sales Tax Act, Tobacco Tax Act, Motor Fuel Tax Act, and Carbon Tax Act. This mandate is carried out by over 150 employees in Victoria and Vancouver, working across six unique sections: Asset Compliance, Fuel & Carbon Tax, Policy, Rulings, & Services, Refunds, Registration & Closures, and Tobacco Tax.

The Business Analyst is responsible for researching and providing on-going analytical and advisory support to management for the ministry's initiatives in customer service, business planning, performance measures, and national and international best practices.

The capital of British Columbia, Victoria is a beautiful city, with beautiful beaches and harbours, and a variety of provincial parks to explore. Located on Vancouver Island, Victoria offers a bustling downtown scene and has a wide range of restaurants and entertainment venues to choose from.

This is your opportunity to live in one of the most beautiful regions in British Columbia and work for the BC Public Service. We offer a healthy work/life balance, excellent benefits and much more.

The BC Public Service is committed to creating a diverse workplace to represent the population we serve and to better meet the needs of our citizens. We acknowledge all Indigenous peoples on whose territories we work and live. We honour their connections to the land and respect the importance of the diverse teachings, traditions, and practices within these territories. Consider joining our team and helping us build an innovative, inclusive and rewarding workplace.

For information about the Indigenous Applicant Advisory Service please visit: Indigenous Applicant Advisory Service - Province of British Columbia (gov.bc.ca)

For complete details about this opportunity, including accountabilities, please refer to the attached job profile. For specific position related enquiries, please contact Donna.Dion@gov.bc.ca. DO NOT SEND YOUR APPLICATION TO THIS EMAIL ADDRESS. For more information about how to complete your job application, add/edit your resume and for more useful tips when applying for jobs, please refer to the Your Job Application page on the MyHR website. If you are still experiencing technical difficulty applying for a competition, please send an e-mail to BCPSA.Hiring.Centre@gov.bc.ca, before the stated closing time, and we will respond as soon as possible to assist you.

NOTE: Applications will be accepted until 11:00 pm Pacific Standard Time on the closing date of the competition.

Job Requirements:
In order to be considered for this position, your application must clearly demonstrate how you meet the education and experience as outlined below:
Graduation from university with a certification in Business Analysis or a related area, such as business administration or computer sciences.
OR equivalent combination of two years progressive education and/or recent experience* in administration and business analysis
Recent experience includes the following:
planning, leading and organizing diverse operational activities and projects to achieve business goals and objectives
data collection and data management, use of databases and accessing data from databases
in business applications, including planning, implementing, testing and developing reports
working with tax legislation, regulations, standards, policies and programs in British Columbia
working collaboratively with various stakeholders on business process change

Minimum 1 year progressive experience in a financial, accounting, auditing or taxation environment
Minimum 2 years’ experience in project management and PM principles

Applicants selected to move forward in the hiring process may be assessed on the Knowledge, Skills, Abilities and Competencies as outlined in the attached Job Profile located in the Additional Information section at the bottom of the posting.

A Criminal Record Check (CRC) will be required.

APPLICATION REQUIREMENTS:
Cover Letter: NO - Please do not submit a cover letter as it will not be reviewed.

Resume required: YES - A resume is required as part of your application; however, it may not be used for initial shortlisting purposes.

Questionnaire (COMPREHENSIVE): YES - As part of the application process, you will be prompted to complete a comprehensive online questionnaire to demonstrate how you meet the job requirements. Please allot approximately 60 minutes to complete the questionnaire.

IMPORTANT: Comprehensive questionnaire responses will be used to shortlist applicants against the job requirements. Please ensure you include all relevant information about your educational accomplishments and employment history including job titles, start and end dates (month and year) of your employment, and your accountabilities and accomplishments.

Title: Senior Business Systems Analyst (Remote, Americas)
Desc:
Company Description
Shopify is a leading global commerce company, providing trusted tools to start, grow, market, and manage a retail business of any size. Shopify makes commerce better for everyone with a platform and services that are engineered for reliability, while delivering a better shopping experience for consumers everywhere. Shopify powers millions of businesses in more than 175 countries and is trusted by brands such as Allbirds, Gymshark, PepsiCo, Staples, and many more.

Job Description
Shopify Support is a team of over 1500 hard-working and dedicated individuals committed to providing a high quality service that enables Merchants all over the world to fulfill their entrepreneurial dreams. Our mission is to make commerce better for everyone and we are constantly innovating how to do this more effectively.
The Support Revenue Operations team is an innovative cross-functional team that connects Shopify+Merchants+Support+Revenue through thoughtful systems and insights that drive outcomes for our business.
About the Role:
The Senior Business Systems Analyst will have a keen eye on the data and metrics that connect our support tooling. They will be a leader on the team responsible to gather insightful data, create data informed strategies, and support the research, design, and implementation of Support’s evolving business systems. The Senior Business Analyst will help Support Revenue Operations drive success through reporting and data analytics that define and measure the success of initiatives and tooling implementation.
This role requires someone that sees the big picture and can effectively liaison between data & analytics teams. Support Revenue Operations is a new implementation of an existing craft and as such educating stakeholders and getting executive buy-in will be fundamental skills to have in addition to a broad technical acumen.
What you will be doing:
Responsible for the data gathering and analytics that are intertwined with Support and Revenue teams tooling.
Support the Revenue Operations team with researching, scoping, and measuring the impact of tooling and process improvements.
Work with the Data and Analytics teams to create insightful data dashboards, visualizations, and validate expected outcomes.
Manage day-to-day Revenue Operations reporting activities to help Support leadership drive priority business outcomes through data insights.
Establish and maintain Revenue Operations and Support tooling KPI’s and driving action items to course correct as necessary.
Creation of Salesforce dashboards and reporting.
Balance strategy and execution to achieve outcomes, by understanding both the big picture as well as the smallest details.
Develop internal networks to cultivate an environment of cross-collaboration both within Support and with other stakeholders and teams.
Consider the impact on merchants, employees, and Shopify, and weigh all 3 in analysis and decision making.
Proactively identify areas of focus and risks and remove roadblocks for the team.

Qualifications
Experience and skills that are important for success in this role:
4+ Years of Experience in Business Analytics or Revenue Operations for a SAAS business.
Advanced knowledge of Excel, Google Sheets, experience with Mode, Tableau or other data visualization tools, Basic SQL, and Github.
Deep understanding of data engineering, statistical methods, data analytics and reporting.
Experience designing data structures to ensure consistent and reliable data collection / reporting capability.
Exceptional data-storytelling skills and ability to conceptualize complex metrics and ideas for various audiences.
Experience working in Sales, Marketing, or Support operations.
Strong aptitude for problem solving.
Excellent interpersonal and collaboration skills - you are able to work effectively with and influence a diverse group of stakeholders.
Practical experience designing, building, and presenting reporting efforts surrounding Go-To-Market performance.
Grit: you are conscientious, resilient, and dedicated to achieving excellence and driving results.
Nice to haves:
Effective public speaker
Experience with remote working
Experience in Marketing, Support or Sales operations
Effective working in SQL
Salesforce certification(s)
Additional Information
We know that applying to a new role takes a lot of work and we truly value your time. We are looking forward to reading your application!
At Shopify, we are committed to building and fostering an environment where our employees feel included, valued, and heard. Our belief is that a strong commitment to diversity and inclusion enables us to truly make commerce better for everyone. We strongly encourage applications from Indigenous peoples, racialized people, people with disabilities, people from gender and sexually diverse communities and/or people with intersectional identities.
Shopify is now permanently remote, and we’re working towards a future that is digital by design. That location you see above? Consider it merely an example of hundreds of potential locations Shopify is hiring. Learn more here: https://www.shopify.com/careers/work-anywhere
Our belief is that a strong commitment to diversity & inclusion enables us to truly make commerce better for everyone. We encourage applications from Indigenous peoples, racialized people, people with disabilities, people from gender and sexually diverse communities, and/or people with intersectional identities. Please take a look at our Sustainability Reports to learn more about Shopify’s commitments to our communities, and our planet.
At Shopify, we understand that experience comes in many forms. We’re dedicated to adding new perspectives to the team - so if your experience is this close to what we’re looking for, please consider applying.

Title: Analyst - Investment banking - Real estate or Diversified
Desc:
Desjardins Group is the largest cooperative financial group in Canada, and one of the largest employers in the country. It offers a full range of financial products and services and is home to a wealth of expertise in property and casualty insurance, life and health insurance, wealth management, services for businesses of all sizes, securities brokerage, asset management, venture capital, and secure, leading-edge virtual access methods.
Job Level
NV-09
Desjardins's Capital Markets (“DCM”) combines the focus of a boutique investment bank with the capabilities of a large, integrated financial institution. DCM’s integrated capital markets team operates out of Toronto, Montréal, Calgary and Vancouver and delivers tailored financial solutions to corporations, institutions and government agencies across Canada. This group fosters an entrepreneurial culture where experienced, highly motivated professionals cooperate to address clients’ capital markets needs and corporate objectives. DCM is a division of Desjardins Financial Group, Canada's leading cooperative financial group with approximately $400 billion in assets.

Desjardins’s Investment Banking Group is looking to add to its growing Toronto team. Analysts are an integral part of Desjardins’s Investment Banking Group and are expected to provide a broad range of analytical, research and presentation preparation support to professionals within the group. They are assigned to a variety of mandates such as mergers & acquisitions, divestitures, equity and debt financings, strategic advisory / alternative projects and full capital structure solution projects. A team approach to executing coverage and financing assignments is designed to provide progressive on the job training.

The role of an analyst is challenging and fast-paced. It requires dedication, passion for the industry and a very solid work ethic.

This/these particular analyst(s) will be primarily focused on one of the Real Estate or Diversified sectors, but the successful candidate can be expected to get involved in other sectors as well.
General Information on the Position
Main Responsibilities
Support in the execution of all facets of a mandate
Financial modeling, mainly focusing on valuation work through comparable company analysis, discounted cash flow analysis and other metrics as appropriate
Quantitative and qualitative data analysis and industry research
Assistance in the preparation of presentation materials for use in client meetings
Must be able to accept flexibility in required personal time commitments to complete work assignments.
Other working conditions
Work place: The work arrangement for the position is hybrid work #LI-Hybrid
Other relevant information : Please include 2-3 sentences on "Why you are interested in the Analyst role" and "Why you want to work at Desjardins Capital Markets"
All inquiries and applications will be held in stricte confidence. We regret that only qualified candidates will be contacted.
Number of jobs available : 2
Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree in a related field
A minimum of four years of relevant experience
A proven academic track record and an undergraduate degree in finance, accounting, engineering or other related fields
Relevant industry experience (an asset)
Prior investment banking experience (an asset)
Please note that other combinations of qualifications and relevant experience may be considered
Current enrollment or completion of the CFA program is considered an asset, but not required
For vacant positions available in Ontario, please note that knowledge of French is required
Specific knowledge
Demonstrated knowledge and strong interest in finance, capital markets, real estate and/or diversified sectors
Strong technical/ computer knowledge (Excel, Word, PowerPoint, Bloomberg, Factset)
Strong communication skills both verbal and written, including the ability to explain detailed financial and statistical analyses
Desjardins Cross-sector skills
Action oriented, Customer Focus, Differences, Nimble learning
Key competencies for the job
Business insight, Complexity
Work Location
25 York Street Toronto
Trade Union
Non Syndiqué
Unposting Date
2022-04-25
Job Family
General finance and accounting (FG)

Title: Senior Business Systems Analyst, Scotia Digital(Vancouver Hub)
Desc:
Requisition ID: 131177  Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

 We are investing heavily in order to become the leader in digital banking space, and we are launching multiple initiatives to do so. You will have a unique chance to help one of the fastest-growing business units become a leader. You will help scale, enable, and drive online & mobile development excellence as our team continues to deliver innovative solutions to Scotia customers.

 In this role, you will:

 Champion a customer focused culture to deepen client relationships and leverage broader Bank relationships, systems and knowledge
 Be the bridge between multiple parties including: our business, control functions, technology partners and our engineering teams, responsible for delivering exciting products in the Digital Banking Unit
 Help scale, enable, and drive online & mobile development excellence as our team continues to deliver innovative solutions to Scotia customers
 Understand how the Bank’s risk appetite and risk culture should be considered in day-to-day activities and decisions
 Actively pursue effective and efficient operations of his/her respective areas in accordance with Scotiabank’s Values, its Code of Conduct and the Global Sales Principles, while ensuring the adequacy, adherence to and effectiveness of day-to-day business controls to meet obligations with respect to operational, compliance, AML/ATF/sanctions and conduct risk


 Do you have the skills that will enable you to succeed in this role?

 3+ years of experience as a Business Systems Analyst in a challenging IT system solution agile or lean environment
 Having an Engineering or Computer Science degree, and pride yourself on analysis, logical thinking and problem-solving skills
 Notice all the little details for every document / requirement / conversation that comes across you, and it drives you crazy that others cannot keep everything consistent
 Do good work, and lots of if; the drive to deliver quality work is just a part of you
 Able to simplify complex situations and navigate ambiguity

 Technical Skills:

 Excellent understanding and experience with microapps and Microservices architecture
 Understanding of JAVA/J2EE, PL/SQL, WebServices- RESTFUL / SOAP (XML & JSON)- OpenAPI and OAuth2.0
 Good Understanding of with JIRA, Confluence, JAMA, SVN Revision Control, Eclipse, TOAD, PL/SQL Developer, MS Office suite, MS Project, Postman, MySQL Workbench
 Familiarity of batch integration patterns, secure file transfer protocols, data security standards.


 What's in it for you?

 We have an inclusive and collaborative working environment that encourages creativity and curiosity and celebrates success!
 We provide you with the tools and technology needed to create meaningful customer experiences
 You'll get to work with and learn from diverse industry leaders, who have hailed from top technology companies around the world
 We hire you for your talent — not just a job — so you can grow with us. We’ll equip you for success not only in your role, but also in your career as a whole
 Dress codes don't apply here: being comfortable does
 Our work from home social channel offers weekly virtual yoga, social events, learning opportunities, and contests to share current experiences & promote wellbeing in our new remote environment
 Access to thousands of online and in-person courses so you can hone your current skills, or learn new ones
 A competitive rewards package that includes a base salary, a performance bonus, company matching programs on pension and profit sharing, paid vacation, personal & sick days, medical, vision, and dental benefits that start from day one and much more!
 Free shuttle service to and from Union Station, onsite subsidized cafeteria with a chef, and an onsite fitness center
 Some of our perks & onsite offerings will be offline as we continue to monitor federal and provincial regulations around COVID-19.

 #vancouverhub

 Location(s): Canada : British Columbia : Vancouver  Scotiabank is a leading bank in the Americas. Guided by our purpose: "for every future", we help our customers, their families and their communities achieve success through a broad range of advice, products and services, including personal and commercial banking, wealth management and private banking, corporate and investment banking, and capital markets.  At Scotiabank, we value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the Bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. If you require accommodation (including, but not limited to, an accessible interview site, alternate format documents, ASL Interpreter, or Assistive Technology) during the recruitment and selection process, please let our Recruitment team know. Candidates must apply directly online to be considered for this role. We thank all applicants for their interest in a career at Scotiabank; however, only those candidates who are selected for an interview will be contacted.

Title: Senior Business Analyst – Marketing
Desc:
Who We Are, What We Do, Where We Are Going
      

        Magnet Forensics is a global leader in the development of digital investigative software that acquires, analyzes and shares evidence from computers, smartphones, tablets and other IoT related devices. We are continually innovating so that our customers can deploy advanced and effective tools to protect their communities, countries and companies.
      



        Headquartered out of Waterloo, ON but with over 400 employees spread out globally, Magnet is continuing to expand and grow. Where we are today, is not where we want to be tomorrow.
      


 Your Role
      

        The Senior Business Analyst (BA) is responsible for creating or improving new or existing business models and processes that support strategic business decisions. The Senior BA will engage with business leaders and team members to analyze systems, data, and processes to identify data-driven changes that will create efficiencies, add value, and deliver on Magnet's Strategic Initiatives. The Senior BA will ensure their recommendations are successfully implemented and adopted throughout Magnet.
      


 What You Will Accomplish
      

Create detailed business analysis that outline opportunities for improvement and supporting solutions
Data analysis
Communicate with business leaders and team members to understand business process and go forward strategies
Act as an expert resource to business leads and team members in designing business processes that introduce efficiencies
Train new and existing users
Creating and maintaining documentation on processes, policies, and help related materials for team members
Assist technical consultants with the development of technical documentation of existing and future applications.
Writing detailed descriptions and workflow diagrams of users current and projected needs program functions, and steps required to modify
Gather and draft requirements and functional specification documents
Provide change management support during system implementation



 What We Are Looking For
      

        We’re looking for someone who checks off most, but not all, of the boxes listed in “skills and experiences”. It’s more important to us to find candidates who can display 
       indicators of success through skills they have developed and experiences they have been a part of, than to find folks who have ‘been there, done that”. We want to be part of your development journey, and we’ll learn as much from you as you learn from us.
       




       There are a couple must haves, but we will keep that list short: 
      

5 + years’ experience work implementing and improving dynamic business process & systems
3 + years’ experience working with marketing business teams
Experience with Salesforce.com and other marketing systems
Ability to work with cross functional teams



 The Most Important Thing
      

        We’re looking for candidates that can provide examples of how they have demonstrated Magnet Inte
       GRITy in their previous experiences:
      

 Greater Good – We think beyond our own interests and strive to improve communities around the world. This demonstrates our passion for making a difference in the world.
      

 Respect – We hold ourselves accountable through transparent sharing of information and we have faith in each other’s abilities
      

 Innovation – We lead the industry in excellence and reliability while keeping the user experience simple and relevant. We are not afraid to push the boundaries to stay ahead of our competitors.
      

 Teamwork – We collaborate internally and externally, while caring about each other and listening to our customers.
      



 Magnet Forensics Inc. is an affirmative action, equal opportunity employer. It is Magnet Forensics policy to recruit and select applicants for employment solely on the basis of their qualifications, with emphasis on selecting the best-qualified person for the job. Magnet Forensics does not discriminate against applicants based on race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, national origin, or disability or any other status or condition protected by applicable law.




 Magnet Forensics encourages applications from all qualified candidates. Magnet Forensics has a great record of accommodating persons with disabilities. Contact our AODA contact at 
aoda@magnetforensics.com
 or 519-342-0195, if you need accommodation at any stage of the application process or want more information on our accommodation policies.

Title: Senior Business Analyst, Distribution Solutions
Desc:
Senior Business Analyst, Distribution Solutions
You will drive business analysis on our key distribution solution metrics and relevant industry trends while seeking innovative efficiencies within the Distribution Solution teams (i.e., standardizing processes, leveraging internal tools & technology).
Location

Toronto , Canada
Our North American Life & Health business is seeking Senior Business Analyst to join our Toronto-based Distribution Solutions team.

Reporting to the Vice President, Distribution Solutions, you will be responsible for the delivery and overall excellence of distribution focused project planning, documentation & execution while engaging with Distribution Solutions team and key stakeholders. You will formulate business plans and leverage Munich Re’s core competencies to empower individual insurance distribution.
Your job
Support business planning & strategy execution
Support communications, marketing, and presentations for VP Distribution Solutions
Formalize project plans and supporting execution of Distribution Solutions projects
Liaise with internal Munich Re partners to assist in project completion
Establish & measure key metrics
Prepare & support VP updates and presentations to senior executives
Understand the Canadian individual insurance landscape including distribution and Munich Re core capabilities

Your profile
Minimum 7-10 years of working in relevant role, recent project-related work experience in project management, business analysis, process design.
University degree or equivalent in Finance or Business preferred
Strong understanding of individual insurance
Proven ability to deliver results and projects on time & with a high degree of accuracy
Strong communicator and collaborator across multiple business units
Attention to detail and thorough, willing to learn new skills
Able to work independently to complete tasks
Demonstrated ability to perform in a dynamic, rapidly changing environment
Understanding of technology tools and how to leverage tech as a force multiplier
Passionate about making a difference and comfortable with ambiguity

About us
Together, we engage with everything we have and are, to help humankind act braver and better.

As the world’s leading reinsurance company with more than 40,000 employees in over 50 locations around the globe, Munich Re introduces a paradigm shift in the way you think about insurance. By turning uncertainty into manageable risk, we enable fundamental change. We recognize Diversity, Inclusion, and Belonging as a key priority with a culture that welcomes different thoughts and opinions. We dare to think big and are continuously innovating on behalf of our clients.

Our data, our technology, and our teams place us in a unique position to drive transformative change in the life insurance industry. We invest strategically in our world class talent, offering our employees a work experience that promotes professional development, innovation, and rewards high performance.
Please note that only candidates who are selected for interview will be contacted directly.
We thank all candidates for their interest.

Apply now! Apply for this Job!
Munich Re Canada is committed to providing a work environment that is inclusive and free of employment barriers and discrimination. Accommodations will be made for qualified applicants with a disability throughout the recruitment process. If you receive a request for an interview and you have a disability which will require an accommodation to support your participation, please consult with Human Resources or contact AODARequestHR@munichre.ca as soon as practical so that suitable accommodations can be arranged.

Title: Senior Performance Analyst
Desc:
1 Full Time Contract Position
INTERNAL/EXTERNAL POSTING

DATE: April 11th, 2022

LOCATION: Toronto, ON
COMPENSATION: $65,986 – $88,016 (Prorated)
CONTRACT DURATION: 1 year

LOFT Community Services is a unique and dynamic charitable organization that supports

people living with complicated issues such as mental and physical health challenges,
substance abuse, poverty and homelessness. Serving over 9,500 people and providing

1,733 units of supportive housing last year, LOFT is one of Ontario’s largest mental health

service providers of its kind.

LOFT is recognized as a Nonprofit Employer of Choice™ Award (NEOC) recipient.


To help fulfill its mission, LOFT is hiring a Senior Performance Analyst
JOB SUMMARY:
The Senior Performance Analyst will work with the other members of the Administration
and System Management team to meet the business and reporting needs of LOFT staff,

program directors, and senior management. The individual will lead the development and

maintenance of all reporting, analytics and quality improvement initiatives.

*Note: All LOFT employees are required to be fully COVID-19 vaccinated as a condition of
hire in accordance with LOFT’s Vaccination Policy. A satisfactory vulnerable sector check
(VSC) is also required.*
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES:
Reporting and Analysis
 
Deliver and maintain weekly, monthly, quarterly reporting products to various
stakeholders.
 Support decision-making, through the development and ongoing maintenance of

strategic and operational reports, key performance indicators, dashboards, and
executive summaries.
 
Work with program directors to identify performance gaps and establish and follow-

up on action plans.
 
Design blueprint and provide recommendations for new reports to turn data into
actionable insights for key stakeholders.
 Manage, prioritize and deliver ad-hoc reporting requests using internal and external

datasets.
 Support the organization in operationalizing the strategic plan, including identifying

and defining KPIs, and building the appropriate scorecards for ongoing performance

management.

Business Requirements
 Bridge the gap between the technical and program functions by translating
requirements both ways
 Support reporting and technology projects by leading the requirements gathering

process; create and manage appropriate documentation e.g. functional
specifications, use cases, user stories, workflow diagrams
 
Develop and lead the QA and UAT process as related to data warehouse and
business intelligence report development.
 
Conduct feasibility analysis; work with stakeholders to identify alternative solutions
to meet end-user needs.

Quality Improvement
 Support the Manager in building a culture of quality and continuous improvement.
 
With the focus on continuous improvement, conduct ongoing
quantitative/qualitative analysis with program directors and senior staff (e.g. key
metrics); proactively assess results and identify and explain unanticipated

variations from targets/budgets and provide improvement recommendations.
 Use quantitative and qualitative methods to define the problem, measure the

current state, identify root cause, and implement and sustain solutions.
 Support quality improvement projects by leading exercises e.g. process mapping
(value stream mapping, fishbone, SIPOC), root cause analysis, etc.
 
Support the knowledge base by creating and delivering articles, user training
sessions and other documentation.

Project Management
 Work closely with project leads and sponsors to define project business and

technical requirements, scope and objectives.
 Use PMBOK guide and principles to plan, execute and deliver IT, reporting and

quality improvement projects within the Administration and System Management

team.
 Support and maintain projects and work plans to ensure completion of deliverables

on time, and escalate project risks as appropriate.
 Support department with development of presentation material where required
 
Perform other duties as necessary.

QUALIFICATIONS:
 
Undergraduate degree in a related field (analytics, statistics, epidemiology, health
informatics, or equivalent) required.
 
A minimum of 5 years relevant work experience.
 
Understanding of Ontario healthcare system, organization, policies, and data
structures.
 
Experience in data analysis, reporting, and the ability to translate information into a
convincing written argument or business case.
 
Experience in translating business requirements into technical and reporting
requirements.
 Understanding of data modelling concepts as they relate to data warehousing and

business intelligence.
 Ability to manipulate and work with large data sets.
 
Experience in leading QA and UAT process.
 
Experience with Microsoft Office tools including Excel, Word and PowerPoint required.
Skilled in creating products (e.g. Reports, presentations) for multiple audiences.
 
Experience with MS SQL and/or Microstrategy is an asset
 Demonstrated experience with process mapping tools and techniques.
 
Strong organizational skills with the ability to manage multiple tasks in parallel; strong
problem-solving skills and demonstrated ability to think critically and strategically.
 
Detail-oriented and process-driven with a demonstrated ability to consistently and
effectively produce high quality work.
 Excellent oral and written communication skills; ability to explain complex concepts in

a manner that is simple and easy to understand.
 Proven team player with strong interpersonal skills including ability to resolve conflicts,

diplomacy, achieve consensus and able to work comfortably with staff and external

stakeholders, including clinicians.
 Innovative thinker with the ability to develop creative solutions to complex problems.
 
Demonstrated ability to work in matrix structure, but with minimal supervision as a
self-starter.
 
Familiar with Quality Improvement/Lean principles and methodologies.
 
Lean/Quality Improvement certification is an asset.
 PMP certification is an asset, MS Project experience is an asset.
 
Experience in healthcare is an asset.
 Experience in writing business case / proposals is an asset.
 
Understanding of cultural competency and anti-oppression framework.
 
Reflective of a multi-barriered group, as serviced by the program, a strong asset.
TO APPLY: Send resume with cover letter to Human Resources, Email: hr@loftcs.org
LOFT Community Services is committed to fostering an inclusive and accessible

environment and dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of the
community in which we live and serve. LOFT is committed to making employment

opportunities accessible in accordance with the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities
Act, 2005. Requested accommodation will be provided in all parts of the application and

hiring process by contacting hr@loftcs.org or (416) 979-1994.

We welcome and encourage people from equity-deserving communities and intersecting
identities to apply for this position.
PLEASE INCLUDE: “SR. PERFORMANCE ANALYST” IN THE SUBJECT LINE OF ANY
EMAILS.
CLOSING DATE: April 29, 2022

Title: Business Analyst, Sales and Trade Analytics
Desc:
Champion Petfoods is expanding! We are excited to announce that we are looking for a Business Analyst, Sales and Trade Analytics to join our rapidly growing company. With thirty years of growth in the global pet food sector, our ORIJEN and ACANA brands define our vision of being Trusted by Pet Lovers Everywhere. If you are passionate about personal and professional growth and see yourself as a key player contributing to our continued success by working in our award-winning company – we would love to hear from you!
Summary
Reporting to the Director of Sales and Trade Analytics, the Business Analyst, Sales and Trade Analytics is a critical company role supporting the Analytics Team to capture and organize relevant data into actionable insights. He or she will help develop these user-friendly insights and in-depth analyses to influence strategic business decisions internally as well as externally with our valued customers. On occasion, the role also comes with direct exposure to senior leadership and strategic customers to help implement growth plans.
This position is based in our corporate head office located in Edmonton, AB.
Responsibilities
Work across multiple data sources (Nielsen proficiency required)
Create dashboards and key reports – practical application of Microsoft PowerBI, or similar data visualization experience is helpful
Distill primary and secondary research down to easy-to-digest insights
Proactively anticipate business and insights needs
Train cross functional teammates on analytics initiatives.
Prepare monthly reports and/or manage special projects, as directed or assigned.
Develop and maintain successful professional working relationships with relevant internal corporate departments and external distributor/customer partners.
Develop, create and explain business analytics to deliver critical insights and fuel growth agendas
Engage in internal analyses, research, product analyses, pricing and assortment strategies
Maintain competitive knowledge to help inform sales strategies
Perform other tasks as required or assigned.
Requirements
Post-secondary education in Business or related field (Bachelor’s degree or equivalent)
Minimum three years related insights and/or analytics experience, preferably within a consumer-packaged goods environment.
Data/Insights mining expert with syndicated tools (Nielsen, POS data, and household panel)
Experienced in creating and building analytical tools and analysis processes.
Customer service orientation with the ability to effectively communicate across diverse stakeholder groups both internal and external.
Strong analytical skills and proven experience translating data into actionable insights.
Strong project management skills and the ability to plan, organize, prioritize, and execute according to timelines.
Ability to attend and/or conduct presentations/meetings.
Hunger for continuous learning and self improvement
Positive contributor to a fun, fast-paced team culture
Some extended hours of work may be required.
Champion is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, age, veteran status, or any other status protected by applicable law.

Title: Business Applications Project Analyst
Desc:
:

General Information:
As an equal opportunity employer, the City of Thunder Bay encourages applications from Indigenous peoples, persons with disabilities, members of visible minority groups and women.
ONTARIO HUMAN RIGHTS CODE: It is a contravention of the Human Rights Code of Ontario to discriminate on the basis of: race, ancestry, place of origin, colour, ethnic origin, citizenship, creed, sex, sexual orientation, marital status, family status, disability, age, record of offences, gender identity or gender expression. Therefore, a resume submitted to the City must not include references to any of the above characteristics. Do not include:

Any certificates that have photo identification
Driver’s licences
Police records checks
Note: The above documentation will be requested by the Human Resources & Division should you be the successful applicant. If a Criminal Record Check is required it will be requested by Human Resources should you be the successful applicant. Please do not submit your Criminal Record Check with your application.
ACCOMMODATION: Reasonable accommodations are available upon request for all parts of the recruitment process.
PRIVACY: Personal information on this form is collected under the authority of the Municipal Act, c. 302, as amended, and will be used to determine eligibility for employment. Questions about this collection of personal information should be directed to the Human Resources & Corporate Safety Division, 125 Syndicate Ave Suite 42, Thunder Bay, Ontario, P7E 6H8, Telephone: 625-3866
Application forms must reference the competition number and be submitted to Human Resources by 11:59 p.m. on the closing date.

Job Description:

POSITION SUMMARY: Under the general direction of the Supervisor, assists in developing and providing effective Business Applications solutions, strategic planning and project management, and applying suitable solutions to meet Departmental and Corporate requirements. Key responsibilities include project management, research, process analysis/reengineering, and planning.
MAJOR RESPONSIBILITIES:
Provides project management services for Business Applications initiatives as directed, including resource requirements, scheduling, planning, and status reporting.
Analyzes and assesses processes; recommends and assists in the deployment of departmental and Corporate process re-engineering activities; establishes business case support including budgetary and resource impact with respect to process improvement recommendations.
Researches potential Business Applications solutions to meet client and/or CIT needs; reports on findings and makes recommendations where required.
Maintains effective and cooperative liaison with clients, vendors, suppliers, service providers, and staff in other organizations; maintains a high standard of public relations at all times.
Assists in the development, implementation, and attainment of Section objectives, work plans, and schedules; assists in the same processes for Departmental and Divisional activities.
Participates in Corporate cross-functional teams improving Corporate IS / IT processes.
Ensures accurate Section records are maintained in accordance with Corporate policies.
Participates in the preparation of annual capital and operating budget for the Section and Division budgets.
Participates in Corporate-wide initiatives and cross-functional teams as required.
Performs such other related duties as may be assigned.
QUALIFICATIONS:
Education/Experience
Degree in computer science, business administration majoring in information systems, or related field, together with a minimum of three years’ related experience with application development technologies, enterprise system software; or
Diploma relating to computer systems/business application development, together with a minimum of five years’ related experience with application development technologies, enterprise system software.
A minimum of one year related project management experience.
Skills/Abilities:
Demonstrated attitude to excel at supporting client excellence
Strong understanding of organizational goals and objectives and project management principles
Superior ability to communicate effectively and concisely, both orally and in writing, with the ability to present ideas in a business friendly and user friendly language
Superior ability to establish and maintain effective working relations with other departments, subordinates, co-workers, and the general public
Ability to improve Divisional effectiveness and efficiency
Knowledge of network hardware, protocols and standards including IP networks, and firewalls
Understanding of applicable data security practices and law
Highly self-motivated and directed
Excellent problem-solving, organizing, and prioritizing
Assets:
Experience with Web, GIS, ERP, and application development technologies
Knowledge of the functions of City departments, outside boards and local community groups
Project management certification
Business analyst certification
CONDITIONS OF EMPLOYMENT:
Must undergo a successful Criminal Record and Judicial Matters Check (CRJMC)
Must sign and abide by Employee Confidentiality Statement
May be required to attend meetings outside regular working hours
May be required to travel to various work locations and provide own transportation
May be required to be on call

Title: Manager, Business Intelligence
Desc:
Altima Dental provides dental care to thousands of Canadians through over 100 locations across Canada. The company is growing rapidly through acquisitions and organically through new and innovative ways. We are hiring a Manager of Business Intelligence to help drive this growth.

Manager Business Intelligence

The Manager of Business Intelligence will play an integral role in expanding the organization’s analytical capabilities and providing value-added analysis to management and business partners. Our team is exploring transformative ways to use business intelligence to enable management to make better and more informed decisions.

The Manager of Business Intelligence will:
Assist in enabling, communicating, and promoting a data culture based on data driven decision-making across the organization
Plan out and manage project milestones and dependencies
Help to choose the best technologies to meet our needs
Deliver key analysis and KPIs in an organized way, including UI/UX design of Power BI reports and dashboards
Develop/improve new and existing Power BI data models
Assist in the maintenance of our data infrastructure and ETL process
Explore data and behavior patterns to improve existing processes
Assist with ad-hoc projects as required

This is a dynamic role with an opportunity for you to develop a broad skillset and to make a meaningful impact within a growing environment. This opportunity will be a perfect fit for an individual with an analytical mindset, a willingness to explore metrics in creative ways, and a keen interest in delivering information in an organized and meaningful way.

Qualifications

University degree/college diploma with 2 to 5 years of relevant experience
Intermediate to advanced level of computer skills, ideally with experience in SQL, Power BI, Excel and Azure
Strong organization and analytical skills with an attention to detail
Excellent communication skills and ability to interact with all levels of the organization
Experience managing projects and people
Working knowledge of the Microsoft Azure platform is an advantage, but not a requirement

We thank all candidates for their interest; however, only those selected for an interview will be contacted.

If accommodation is needed in the application process, or those needing job postings in an alternative format please e-mail a request to hr@altima.ca.

Altima strongly believes that diversity in the workplace is essential to our success. As a result, we are committed to providing equal opportunities regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or Veteran status.

Title: Land and Permits Interface Analyst, Expansion Project
Desc:
Date: Apr 8, 2022
Location: Burnaby, British Columbia, Canada
Company: Trans Mountain
The Trans Mountain Expansion Project will provide increased capacity to support Canadian crude oil production growth and ensure access to global energy markets. The largest project in the pipeline’s history, it involves installing approximately 980 kilometres of new pipeline, as well as new and modified facilities.


As a Land and Permit Interface Analyst with Trans Mountain, you’ll have the opportunity to work on our major project team, with a progressive and fast-paced group of Land and Permitting professionals. This team is working to deliver the required land and permit access for construction. This position is based in our Burnaby office.
Key Responsibilities
Analyze requirements for land, permits and project schedules, to determine priorities and alignment with land and permit acquisition teams.
Coordinate with engineering and survey teams to acquire land, crossings, and road lists and drawings in order to expedite land and permits delivery.
Produce readiness reports as required for discrete construction packages and spreads.
Track actions, issues, risks and dependencies associated with land and permits delivery.
Provide an interface with Project Management and General Contractors to align project requirements with land and permits delivery.
Track commitments and conditions derived from agreements and permits to ensure compliance.
Ensure all documentation is available to the General Contractor through the Construction Binder.
Ensure the Line Lists are complete and representative of land and permits delivery.
Maintain Permitting Registers of all permits, licenses, notifications, approvals, registrations and other authorizations.
Tracking Permit status (under preparation, lodged, obtained), key milestone dates and approval conditions.
Maintaining copies of applications, supplementary information and granted permits on the Projects document management system.
Provision of weekly, monthly, and ad hoc reports relating to land and permits delivery.
Support the project management and land/permits leadership in understanding of data and data analysis.

Qualifications and Professional Experience
Undergraduate degree in Business, Engineering, Computer Science, or similar field, preferred.
3-6 years of project related experience.
Excellent Microsoft Excel skills.
Analytical mindset with demonstrated critical thinking and problem-solving skills as well as the ability to adapt to changing priorities and deadlines. Approaches challenges with mental tenacity and ability to overcome resistance and competing priorities.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Strong organization skills.
Ability to attend to detail and work in a time-conscious and time-effective manner.

In the Fall of 2021, the Government of Canada expressed its expectation that all federally owned or regulated companies (including Trans Mountain) implement polices to ensure that all employees are fully vaccinated against COVID-19.

In order to be considered as a candidate for a position with Trans Mountain, you must be fully vaccinated or eligible for accommodation based on a certified medical contraindication, religion, or another prohibited ground for discrimination as defined under the Canadian Human Rights Act or applicable human rights legislation.
We Build Careers and Pipelines That Last
Our story is about determination, resourcefulness and resilience. It’s about charting our own course, finding innovative solutions to challenging problems and doing the right thing. It was true when Trans Mountain became a company in 1951 and it’s just as true today. We welcome new members to our team that embrace the qualities in our story, that thrive on the new path and directions we take. Our culture is one of care and taking our responsibilities seriously. If you would like to contribute to our culture, then join our journey.

A Rewarding Opportunity. We offer:
A place to share a sense of purpose and build relationships.
Meaningful work that makes a difference.
An opportunity within the Canadian energy industry.

In keeping with Trans Mountain’s commitment to maximize benefits for communities, priority will be given to qualified candidates from Indigenous, local and regional communities along the Trans Mountain existing, and expansion, pipeline corridor.

In Alberta, the existing pipeline system spans the traditional territories of Treaty 6, 7 and 8, and the Métis Nation of Alberta (Zone 4).

In British Columbia, the system crosses the traditional territories of numerous First Nations that are affiliated with the Secwepemc, Dakelh (Carrier), Nlaka'pamux, Syilx/Okanagan, Interior and Coast Salish, Stó:lo, as well as the Métis.
Trans Mountain also operates through 15 First Nation Reserves located within the region spanning the BC interior through Fraser Valley.

Our Commitment to Diversity and Inclusion
Trans Mountain is committed to supporting diversity and individual differences. The diverse viewpoints and cultural knowledge that our employees bring to work enrich our organization’s collective cultural understanding, which is reflected in the work we do every day. Trans Mountain welcomes new team members from traditionally underrepresented groups, including women, Indigenous Peoples, members of visible minorities and persons with disabilities.

Title: Business Intelligence Developer (6 month FTC)
Desc:
Purpose
The BI Developer (6 month FTC) reports into the Manager of Analytics.
The BI Developer will be responsible for planning, development, implementation, and maintenance of the organization’s Microsoft Power BI environment and Business Intelligence report development and user reports analysis. They will work closely with Business Analysts and Stakeholders to drive requirements and deliver solutions that meet and exceed those requirements. They will also work with Database/ETL Programmer to implement their designs.
Key Areas of AccountabilityMonitor and investigate new versions, technologies and techniques as well as advises management on adoption strategiesWork closely with Business Analysts and stakeholders to understand and document business and data requirementsIn concert with the Business Data Analyst, identify appropriate sources of Data Warehouse dataDesign, develop, implement metadata management processes, and best practicesDesign, develop and schedule/automate reports to internal and external stakeholdersEnsure implementation of best practices for data warehouse environmentsImplementation of Microsoft Power BI data models, reports, and dashboardsDevelop, document, and execute test plansResolve issues and inconsistencies in the dataSearching for causes of incompatibility between the warehouse and other systemsIdentify software patches and upgrades and collaborate with IT to ensure the organization’s BI environment is fit for purpose and fit for growthAdminister user access and securityCollaborate with Data Engineer to tune the analytics environment for optimal performance
Qualifications
Education / Certifications / LicensesBachelor’s Degree in technical or business discipline or equivalent experienceMicrosoft Power BI certification highly preferred
Experience3-5 years of Microsoft Power BI development/administration experience. Must have current experience with Microsoft Power BI, Microsoft Power Automate, Microsoft SSRS, Microsoft Power BI Report Builder and demonstrate experience building paginated reports6+ years of overall experience within the Business Intelligence/Data Warehousing spaceStrong background with entity relational and dimensional modeling, star schema design, and meta data modelingExperience defining data and user class security for reports and packagesExperience translating business requirements into functional requirements, and translating those into reporting objects and reporting data requirementsSolid experience in BI and Data Warehousing concepts OLAP, Cubes, etc.Solid hands-on experience creating tools with ad hoc reporting capabilitiesExperience in design patterns, development methodologies, delivery models etc.Knowledge of IT concepts, strategies, and methodologies, architectures, and technical standardsKnowledgeable in new and emerging business intelligence and visualization technologiesPreferred candidates should have data modeling, metadata management and Microsoft SSIS experience
SkillsFluent in SQL (SqlServer / SSIS)Strong relational database skillsStrong communication skills and interpersonal skills
Covid - 19 Vaccination Policy:
Rocky Mountaineer (RM) is committed to the safety and health of our team members through providing a safe working environment. As a federally regulated transportation organization, we have a duty to comply with all applicable legislative requirements.
Therefore, all individuals who will start working with RM on November 12, 2021, onwards, will be required to present proof of vaccination confirming they are fully vaccinated against COVID-19 prior to beginning their employment. An individual is fully vaccinated 14 days after receiving their second dose of a two-dose COVID-19 vaccine series or their first dose of a one-dose approved vaccine by Health Canada. Offers of employment to start work with RM on or after November 12, 2021, will be conditional upon receipt of proof of the job candidate being fully vaccinated against COVID-19.
Note: Reasonable accommodations will be considered if they comply with the medical or religious exemptions permitted by applicable federal legislation and ministerial orders.
